Thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds

Supernatural thriller based on Dean Koontz's novel, starring Anton Yelchin and Willem Dafoe

Director Timothy Woodward Jr's horror thriller, starring Michael Welch, Lin Shaye and Spencer Locke

programme.title: Lovejoy

Lovejoy is approached by a man offering a generous sum for it, claiming a family connection. Later, after the item is subjected to a bungled burglary attempt investigations reveal it may hold the key to the location of buried treasure. Ian McShane stars

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Sahira digs in her heels over Hanssen's new 'micro-management' system, but reconsiders her actions when it becomes clear he is under pressure. Chantelle's role of evacuation warden seems questionable when she starts the day by damaging Ric's car, but tries her best to redeem herself. Sacha puts his team first over the diagnosis of a patient, but Chrissie goes behind his back to prove he is wrong to do so

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mary's unemployed father collapses during a visit and is rushed to Holby. Meanwhile, a boy is treated after being knocked unconscious. Starring Bernard Gallagher

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina Gold and Gary Best fear the worst after hearing gunshots from the warehouse where Ken Drummond and his son are being held hostage. Dale Smith goes undercover in a high-security prison in an attempt to find out where the stolen sports cars have been hidden, and the hunt is on for whoever's responsible for the sudden influx of teenage prostitutes in the area

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: An increasingly pressurised Vicki relies on Dennis's support as she decides her baby's future. Anthony is overcome by guilt, and Kat goes to town on a surprise for Alfie

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kareena tells her brothers it's time to come clean. Dennis meets up with an old acquaintance in an effort to help Tony

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth

programme.title: Lovejoy

programme.desc: Andrew encounters a patient whose sister is unwittingly killing him with kindness, while Sam encourages a grieving husband to pick up the pieces of his shattered life and accept responsibility for his baby daughter _ in spite of her heartbreaking legacy. On the personal front, Joanna confides in Carol about her one-night stand at the college reunion. Rural drama, starring Haydn Gwynne

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Harvey decides that if Diana and Tom are seen to be mentally incompetent it will give him power of attorney over their affairs and end all his woes. However, the couple are wise to him, and plan a well-orchestrated display for the visiting psychiatrist. Comedy, with Graham Crowden, Stephanie Cole and Daniel Hill

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: After recruitment for his Merry Men hits an all-time low, a letter from an enthusiast with excellent credentials gets Billy excited again, and he organises a committee to greet the newest member. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lenny hears a voice from above, and decides he must wait patiently for more information, leaving the gang to make sure he is well-equipped to receive messages. Comedian Bobby Ball returns as the gullible pickle factory worker, with Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: A carpet magnate is killed in an accident at his warehouse, but his youngest daughter suspects foul play and hires Frank and Luella to investigate her own two sisters

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: A simple missing person's case takes a dramatic turn as Frank and Lu find themselves in the middle of a dispute over the opening of a new Shakespeare Centre where it's clear that no one is what they seem. Simon Williams and Josie Lawrence guest star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a bloodstained pair of hot pants results in the team being asked to reinvestigate the 1971 disappearance of a mother and her six-month-old son. Lane, who worked on the original case, quickly identifies the victim's husband as the chief suspect, but when Halford and Standing learn two other women went missing in the area on the same day, they suspect they are looking for a serial killer. Amanda Redman stars

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Harry and Nikki are close by when an RAF helicopter crashes into a detention centre for failed asylum seekers. When it seems the military are trying to hush up the incident they each open their own investigations - to prove the pilot was not at fault for the crash and identify a mysterious girl who fled the site amid the carnage. Tom Ward and Emilia Fox star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Frances panics when Mother Mildred insists that she attend her first solo birth before Nurse Crane returns, and Trixie treats a pregnant woman who discovers that she has gonorrhoea, a condition that could have serious implications for the health of her baby. The Turners try to persuade Violet to approve the formation of a Brook Advisory Centre, and Lucille looks forward to a second date with Cyril

programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is asked to furnish a restaurant, but the items he acquires turn out to be stolen. To make matters worse, the owners turn up for the establishment's opening night. John Wells guest stars, with Ian McShane

Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Originally broadcast in 1975

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg takes care of a friendly dog for the day, but when Truly, Billy and Alvin visit, the canine ferociously guards his new minder's house, leaving the gang to spend a day on the doorstep thinking up ambitious plans to negotiate their entry. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: After concluding she needs a new means of transport, Auntie Wainwright sends Tom and Smiler on a mission to collect her new vehicle - but it doesn't quite live up to their expectations. Jean Alexander, Tom Owen and Stephen Lewis star

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: After a man is found hanging in the conservatory following a poetry recital, the priest soon realises he could not have committed suicide, and the search for a murderer begins. Drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Felix gets more than he bargained for when a bawdy film production comes to Great Slaughter

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Halford visits a clairvoyant in the hope of making contact with his dead wife, but instead receives a message from a teenage girl who was abducted and left to die in a transport container in 1982. Despite the unconventional nature of the new evidence, Pullman agrees to reopen the investigation. The ageing detectives become convinced it will be their final case when they are ordered to report for physical and psychological evaluation. James Bolam, Amanda Redman and Robert Bathurst star

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The discovery of a child's mutilated body in a river forces Leo to face a ghost from his past. Questions are raised as to whether the victim was murdered in a ritual killing, and evidence points the team in the direction of a nearby church. Meanwhile, Nikki investigates the apparently suspicious death of a priest from a local Catholic boys' school

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Shelagh organises a ballroom dance to raise money for the maternity home, in the hope of taking her mind off May's impending adoption. A terminally ill patient laments that she will not get the chance to dance one last time, but Sister Hilda is determined to make sure she does. Fred suffers an embarrassing condition, and cannot bring himself to see Dr Turner, while Nurse Crane is discharged from hospital and tries to play matchmaker between Sgt Woolf and Miss Higgins. Valerie and Trixie are called to testify in a court case

programme.desc: Richard Wilson joins the cast as a new doctor who arrives in Ormston, much to the dismay of Tom who learns the newcomer's timely appearance has been engineered by his father. programme.title: Pie in the Sky

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The final episode of the detective drama sees Gently testifying against corrupt Met officers as he prepares to retire from the force. However, he is persuaded to take on one final investigation - re-opening the case of a woman who was murdered four years previously. Gently's search for the truth leads him to investigate a reforming politician who is tipped to become the next prime minister and uncover a web of political intrigue that places Bacchus and Rachel in danger. Starring Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and Lisa McGrillis

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The chairman of the Classic Car Restoration Society is found dead alongside his beloved El Dorado with a lungful of gasoline. They also wonder whether it was linked to an unidentified dead body found in his garage the day before. Neill Rea and Fern Sutherland star

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: Rebellion
programme.desc: A ruthless campaign of executions is carried out, but the deaths have the unintended result of building public support for the defeated rebels. As prisoners are shipped to England, May is persecuted by the authorities, while Frances is driven to take drastic action

programme.title: The Split

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: A film star arrives from America and throws a summer garden party for the entire village of St Mary Mead - where one of her fans drinks a poisoned cocktail and promptly drops dead. Fortunately, the guest list includes Miss Marple, who immediately sets about tracking down the killer. Feature-length drama, starring Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom and Barry Newman

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: When a series of monstrous and seemingly indiscriminate killings become ever more audacious and public, DCI John Luther and new recruit DS Catherine Halliday are confounded by a complex tangle of leads and misdirection that seems designed to protect an untouchable corruption. But, even as the case brings him closer than ever to the true face of evil, a reluctant Luther is forced to confront the unburied demons of his own recent past. Idris Elba stars, with Wunmi Mosaku and Patrick Malahide

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: An update on Hazel, the first southern koala born in Europe. There's another milestone for this precious baby, she has to be separated from her mother by the keepers for a short period. This is to ensure the keepers earn the baby's trust before she becomes impossible to work with. Their intention is to separate Hazel from her mother for 10 minutes without distressing either of the animals. Plus, a specialist osteopath attends a monitor lizard suffering a worrying issue with his spine

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore heads to Scotland's east coast on the lookout for quality discards at Wallyford Recycling Centre. programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

Amid the local ships, the pair dig up some wooden toys, prized pottery and very shiny things to sell. Irita visits an antiques emporium that's so new, it hasn't even opened yet and also gets her hands on something that brings back happy memories of childhood. Raj, meanwhile, heads off to hear the story of one of the great adventurers of the 20th century, as told by the son of the great man himself

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: The Wrights are in Scotland, starting out in the Cairngorns National Park, where Josh chooses to go bungee jumping - knowing full well that brother Mark has a fear of heights. Next up is a ride through the countryside on Segway scooters, but the brothers' rivalry comes to the fore once more and it turns into an insane race. Things become a little more relaxed when they spend the night in an idyllic cabin on the shores of Loch Lomond, followed by a fishing trip. But will any of them make a catch?

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.desc: In Herefordshire, Jules Hudson discovers why a good dose of country air might not be all that it's cracked up to be. John Craven enjoys the breathtaking north Cornwall coast, and Paul Martin is in Bannau Brycheiniog helping a mission to save Britain's most endangered mammal - the water vole

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of a three-bedroom terrace in Rugby, a former working men's club in Bolsover and a semi-detached in Nottingham

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Kingston Antiques Centre, and explores the home of the Wimbledon tennis championships. With experts Charles Hanson and Thomas Forrester

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest joins forces with Flambeau to search for a lost treasure in a 15th-century castle. Crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, with Mark Williams and John Light

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Longleat's tiger breeding programme has been a huge success with a male and female born three years ago. The precious cubs are now almost fully grown, and nearing the age when they could be separated to start their own families. The keepers now want to assess the male's strength, and determine if he has developed enough to cope on his own should he be moved to another breeding programme so have built a massive spring to test the father and son's strength. Plus, wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin tries to capture some shots of the latest addition to the park - a two-toed sloth

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a first-time buyer from Birmingham to find a home in the Shropshire countryside, and helps out by pulling pints for the locals at a community-owned pub

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull come up with designs for an overgrown garden in the Shropshire town of Telford that is little more than a pile of rubble, drawing inspiration from the travels of owners Rhi and Alex

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott embrace their inner pirate as they plunder the shops of the Cornish peninsula. Raj makes some big finds in one of the tiniest shops of the trip and pins his hopes on a risky item that may or may not be highly collectable. Irita plumps for a very cheap purchase and finds a painting that reminds her of her childhood and also contains a hidden secret. Along the way there's still time for some sightseeing, kite-flying and, of course, pirate impressions. The pair then head to the final auction to see who will emerge victorious

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Lauren Laverne

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: Harry from Newcastle embarks on his first pigeon racing season. Inspired by his father's love of the birds, he is going to see if he can rear a team of winners and take on the more mature members of the South Gosforth Homing Society

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the conclusion of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes. The guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Satirist, presenter and producer Munya Chawawa, comedian Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and radio presenter Snoochie Shy join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee's lifestyle catches up on him and he is forced to wait on a hospital ward for routine surgery on his gallbladder until his blood pressure comes down. But visits from the parents-in-law and Anna and Toby, who arrive to ask him a question he doesn't want to hear, ensure that his stress levels remain dangerously high. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Georgie's golden child of a brother, Prince Freddie - the heir to the British throne - pays an unexpected visit with some unwelcome news from their parents. Furious, she runs off and is nowhere to be found, prompting Freddie and her staff to embark on a frantic search for the missing monarch. Catherine Tate and Daniel Lapaine star

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Heat (2013)
programme.desc: An uptight, ambitious FBI agent is sent to Boston to bring a notorious drug kingpin to justice. She ends up forced to team up with a rebellious, foul-mouthed local police detective who has a very different attitude to law enforcement but shares her inability to work with others. Action comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Melissa McCarthy

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Paul Ainsworth and Angela Hartnett, plus special guest Les Dennis. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: In the third episode, Nadiya Hussain shares some of her favourite savoury dishes, including a chicken and pink peppercorn pie, and simple, baked teriyaki noodles which are the perfect fuss-free midweek meal. Nadiya also demonstrates how to make a tear and share bread loaf with all the flavours of a pizza

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather

programme.title: Tennis: Eastbourne
programme.desc: The Rothesay International Eastbourne Tennis Tournament. Live coverage of the final of the women's grass court tournament from Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club. Two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova took the honours here last year, prevailing 6-3, 6-2 against 2-17 French Open-winner Jelena Ostapenko

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph presents the show from High Wycombe recycling centre, where the experts set to work restoring a pine wardrobe, a pair of old sun loungers, and two metal garden chairs

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young Essex couple need Nicki Chapman's help to find them a new home in Somerset. Nicki also visits a local farm to sample some homemade specialities made from an ancient grain

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public, including an anatomy model, a set of antique printing drawers and a 1950s toy telephone

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Kim's relatives live all over the world, and when they do visit, they avoid gathering in Kim's tired, unloved garden. This prompts Flo Headlam and Charlie Dimmock to head to Luton, Bedfordshire, to create a cottage garden for Kim who has a budget of £4,000 to make the most of the outdoor space

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Across three rounds, best friends from Reading and Norfolk, a mother and daughter from London and siblings from Belfast have their knowledge put to the test

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night game show, as contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. Helping today's contestants out are Claudia Winkleman, Big Narstie, Alex Brooker, Gabby Logan, Debbie McGee, Jamie Laing and Patrick Grant

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz, as Jamie Laing, James Argent, Griff Rhys Jones, Nina Wadia, Lee Latchford Evans, Claire Richards, Sindhu Vee and Tiff Stevenson try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Rumours of Jodie's apparent affair with Max spiral out of control, forcing her to resign. However, her leaving party ends in disaster when the pub explodes. Donna struggles to keep control of the new nurses and worries she isn't a good enough role model for them, but Rida and Cam prove her wrong

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Drama created by bestselling novelist Candice Carty-Williams, about the rivalry between brother and sister rappers. Talented songwriter Vita supports her brother Bosco as he strives to rebuild his musical career following a prison sentence. However, she comes to realise he will never appreciate what she does for him, and decides to strike out on her own as a solo artist. Starring Déja J Bowens and Malcolm Kamulete

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: PS I Love You (2007)
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Good Vibrations (2012)
programme.desc: A music lover in 1970s Belfast opens a record shop while his city is torn apart by the Troubles. His business introduces him to the city's underground punk scene, and he becomes one of the key figures in creating an alternative subculture to the violence around him. Fact-based drama, starring Richard Dormer, Jodie Whittaker, Liam Cunningham and Dylan Moran

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Originally from India, Bindu grew up with a garden full of vegetables, nature and birdsong and would like to recreate a bit of that in her modest garden in Warrington, Cheshire. The garden is a sun trap, so she and partner Vivek want some height and shade in the plot as well as raised beds for fruit and veg growing. It's very important to them that they try and care for the environment too so would like the means to harvest rainwater and compost waste. With a relatively small budget of £3,000, Charlie Dimmock and Lee Hull create a garden that is both eco-friendly and looks beautiful

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is at Witley recycling centre in Surrey, where she rescues a G-Plan unit, a bookcase and a papasan seat with the help of artist Zoe Murphy and restorer Peter Fournel

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: As the team celebrates our seas, Gillian Burke ventures down the Llyn Peninsular and explores a seagrass meadow. Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan continue to explore the array of wildlife at RSPB Arne in Dorset

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Tennis: Eastbourne
programme.desc: The Rothesay International Eastbourne Tennis Tournament. Gigi Salmon presents live coverage of day four of the women's grass court tournament from Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club, featuring the singles quarter-finals. Harriet Dart was the final British player to be eliminated from the tournament at this stage last year, losing 6-3, 6-4 to eventual champion Petra Kvitova. There were also victories for Jelena Ostapenko and Camila Giorgi against Anhelina Kalinina and Viktoriya Tomova respectively

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Muncaster Castle in Cumbria, where experts Caroline Hawley and James Lewis choose items to take to auction. James is drawn to a collection of First World War memorabilia and Caroline finds an exciting collection of postcards. Plus, Paul meets an artist whose work has led him back in time to the ancient art of relief printing

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Maisie Adam, Ivo Graham, Dev Griffin and Zoe Lyons test their general knowledge skills ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the latest leg on the seafront at Felixstowe, where in January 1953 the town was engulfed in the worst flooding to hit England in the 20th century. In Norwich, he admires the Norman Cathedral, then traces the history of the postcode

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day two of the Second Test in the five-match series, which comes from Lord's. The sides drew here in the last series on English soil in 2019, with Ben Stokes claiming the man of the match award after a second innings total of 115 put England in a commanding position. However, a half-century by the first concussion replacement in Test history Marnus Labuschagne helped the Aussies earn a draw

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton follows the eastward course of the river South Esk from its source in the hills above Glen Clova to the Montrose Basin, and on to the sea. Along the way he searches for Scotland's rarest plant, goes electro-fishing to discover more about the ecology and general health of the whole river system, and rides a motorbike to the ancestral home of Harley-Davidson

programme.title: Inside the Iranian Uprising
programme.desc: In September 2022, a 22-year-old Iranian woman, Mahsa Amini, died in police custody. She had been arrested by Iran's religious police, accused of not wearing her hijab properly. The authorities said she had died of a heart attack, but rumours spread that she had been beaten on arrest. Furious citizens took to the streets in their thousands. In a country with no freedom of speech or free reporting, they filmed themselves. This documentary reveals what has been happening across Iran, revealing a regime under huge pressure, resorting to extreme cruelty to control its citizens

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy sketch show first screened in 1998, with Amelia Bullmore, Julia Davis, Simon Pegg, Mark Heap and Kevin Eldon. Characters include a flamenco-dancing bomb disposal unit and a French-speaking tortoise

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Three years ago, 35-year-old Ben went on a drink and drugs binge that ended with a failed bank robbery, having been released and reoffended numerous times before. His mum Denise desperately wants him to be given another chance, but is his drugs addiction so uncontrolled that the board will keep him locked up to protect the public? Thirty-year-old Jai has been in and out of prison since the age of fifteen and hopes that the board will think he has matured enough to put his criminal past behind him

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Dentist Rhona Eskander discusses the red flags in teeth whitening scams and the team talk about the diabetes drug people are using for weight loss. Housing campaigner holds landlords to account for problems such as mould, damp, infestation and neglect and Dr Xand investigates the most common myths around sleep. Plus the largest maternity scandal in the history of the NHS that started with one grieving mother and ended up involving 1,486 families

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture displays of emotion from sea creatures, including dolphins getting an adrenaline rush from jumping, leaping and playing tricks in the waves. Spy cameras also capture displays of affection among manatees and cuttlefish courtship, as well as the mimic octopus passing itself off as other creatures to avoid predators

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of properties in Alfreton in Derbyshire, Brightlingsea in Essex and Maidstone in Kent

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph finds a drop-leaf table, a collection of canvas frames and a monk's bench in Buckinghamshire at High Wycombe recycling centre and tries to upcycle them to sell with the help of Tristan Merriam and woodworker Martin Hough

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring Ramona Jones, who was diagnosed with autism in her twenties and discovered how she can find her true identity when she is in the garden. Monty Don makes some changes to pots in the Jewel Garden, and also plants out squash and harvests gooseberries. Adam Frost visits an Arts and Crafts garden in North Yorkshire, and finds much to inspire and surprise. And Rekha Mistry reveals her new garden in the Peak District

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Tennis: Eastbourne
programme.desc: The Rothesay International Eastbourne Tennis Tournament. Live coverage of day five of the women's grass court tournament from Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club, featuring the singles semi-finals. Two-time Wimbledon Petra Kvitova overcame Beatriz Haddad Maia 7-6, 6-4 at this stage last year. There was also a win for a Grand Slam champion in the other match, with 2017 French Open title-winner Jelena Ostapenko comfortably prevailing 6-2, 6-2 against Camila Giorgi

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Previously unseen finds from the show's travels on visits to Muncaster Castle in Cumbria, the Bowes Museum in Co Durham, the Grand Pier in Weston-super-Mare in Somerset and Norwich Cathedral. The antiques experts include Caroline Hawley, Kate Bateman, Thomas Plant, David Harper and Jonathan Pratt with items ranging from Black Forest carvings to a delicate oil painting completed on glass by the artist Bessie Bamber. Presenter Paul Martin also takes a look at the lavish interiors and the beautiful gardens at Powis Castle in mid-Wales

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Maisie Adam, Ivo Graham, Dev Griffin and Zoe Lyons test their general knowledge skills before Richard Osman announces the week's victor

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: At RAF Lakenheath, Michael Portillo discovers a slice of America dropped into the British countryside. In the market town of Brandon on the border between Norfolk and Suffolk, he visits Quorn Foods to find how a seemingly modern meat substitute emerged out of a post-war food crisis. Michael ends his journey in Cambridge, where he studied during the 1970s

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the third day of the Second Test in the five-match series, which comes from Lord's. Since a draw between the sides here in 2019, England have a mixed record at this venue, claiming a draw and a victory against New Zealand, losing to India and South Africa and, most recently, defeating Ireland

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the upper reaches of the River Dee, which rises higher than any river in the UK, from the Cairngorm mountains to Royal Deeside. In the heart of the Cairngorm mountains, he learns about writer and mountain lover Nan Shepherd's passion for the living landscape. Later on Royal Deeside, Paul is intrigued by the story of John Brown - Queen Victoria's very special friend who's photograph and ring she took to the grave

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives a masterclass on rambling, climbing and shrub roses. With The Hampton Court Garden Festival just around the corner in July, Carol is at home immersing herself in some of the plants she's growing for her highly ambitious show garden. And wildlife champion Kate Bradbury discovers a fascinating array of moths in her garden

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy sketch show. The Fat Sweaty Coppers try to solve a burglary, Ron Manager talks about Ryan Giggs, and Unlucky Alf has an accident with a cricket ball. Elsewhere, Prof Denzil Dexter conducts an experiment using some cardboard tubes

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Faisal Islam

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: A look back at last weekend's festival, when the likes of Elton John, Lizzo, Arctic Monkeys, Guns N' Roses, Kelis, Lewis Capaldi, Blondie and Rick Astley took to the stage

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at how after decades of violence a breakthrough was reached in the form of the Good Friday Agreement in 1998, after years of talks at government level and with the intervention of US president Bill Clinton. The programme also examines the legacy of the Troubles, with its effects on victims and survivors being lasting and significant

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team head to Chelmsford to help a family of four who are overwhelmed by their home. They have 24 hours and a minimal budget to transform and clean their neglected house

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: When Timmy sees a particularly grumpy farmer giving one of the flock a hard time, he decides to give him an idea of what it's like to be a sheep. However, when the time comes to have the old farmer back, things aren't quite so simple.

programme.desc: Kai and Karen go head to head with Oscar and John as they compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final and become ultimate champions

programme.desc: The brothers find out how animals use vegetation to survive

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: A fan takeover of the show

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads to Gabon in search of crocodiles, chimpanzees and feisty elephants

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: Sheridan Smith presents as the second group of quarter-finalists give some scruffy bichons frisés their trademark white cloud look, and try to identify a cross-breed's two parents. In the final challenge, they must trim their dogs' coats to create a homage to a place close to their hearts, before showing off their creations on the Dogwalk. But who will judges Verity Hardcastle and Colin Taylor take through to next week?

programme.title: Undiscovered Worlds with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The explorer sets out to become the first person to reach the summit of a mountain in Greenland's Arctic wilderness. This already dangerous expedition is made all the more treacherous by the impact of climate change, as rising temperatures in the Arctic cause the ice sheets to melt. He must also brave rivers of freezing meltwater, quicksand, and treacherous glacial ice

programme.title: Rick Stein Tastes the Blues
programme.desc: The chef charts how the culinary and musical traditions of the Mississippi Delta have intertwined throughout history, and learns about the people who live along the river's banks. He visits restaurants, bars and famous concert venues to trace the stories of the region's colonial past and the famous musicians who shaped the evolution of the blues

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Cooking
programme.desc: The food writer makes a classic savoury pie with a puff pastry crust, and puts traditional pizza ingredients together in a new way to make an entirely original dish

programme.title: In Which We Serve (1942)
programme.desc: When a British destroyer is torpedoed during the Battle of Crete, surviving crew members are left clinging to the wreckage and recall their previous adventures at sea - and the reasons why they enlisted for service in the first place. Second World War drama, starring Noel Coward, who co-directed with David Lean, alongside John Mills, Bernard Miles, Celia Johnson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: Escape to Athena (1979)
programme.desc: Second World War Allied PoWs incarcerated on a Greek island plan to defy the SS by breaking out of prison and pulling off an art robbery, with the help of their liberal-minded camp commandant. Action adventure, with Roger Moore, David Niven, Telly Savalas, Elliott Gould, Stefanie Powers and Claudia Cardinale

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction. Paul Martin presents

programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v Australia. Coverage of the first of three T20s in the multi-format women's Ashes series, held at Edgbaston. Australia won two matches in this format during the 2021-22 series in the southern hemisphere, with the other contest abandoned due to rain, but England will hope for improved showings on home soil as they look for their first Ashes triumph since 2014. Four points were awarded for the winner of the Test match that opened the series at Trent Bridge, or two apiece if it was a draw, with two points handed to the victor in each of the T20s and three one-dayers that follow

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The singer-songwriter performs with his band and a 16-piece string orchestra, playing tracks from new album Council Skies, including Pretty Boy, Open the Door, See What You Find and the title track, There also songs from the High Flying Birds and Oasis back catalogues, including a B-side that Noel has never performed live before. Noel also joins Jools for chats at the piano and looks back at his performances on the show over the years

programme.title: Reel Stories: Noel Gallagher
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary chats to the singer about his life, showing clips of some of his most memorable TV appearances on shows including Top of the Pops, The Word and Newsnight. The programme looks back at Oasis' earliest TV appearances in the 1990s, the band's break-up, and his subsequent career with new band High Flying Birds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: A special edition of the show featuring appearances by the band on the long-running music programme. First broadcast in 1998

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day four of the Second Test in the five-match series, which comes from Lord's. The sides drew here in the last series on English soil in 2019, with Ben Stokes claiming the man of the match award after a second innings total of 115 put England in a commanding position. However, a half-century by the first concussion replacement in Test history Marnus Labuschagne helped the Aussies earn a draw

programme.title: Thanks for the Memories
programme.desc: Part one of two. Joyce is happy with her life, but everything is turned on its head when an accident requires a blood transfusion and she wakes up with memories that are not hers. Romantic comedy based on a novel by Cecelia Ahern, starring Tom Wlaschiha and Tamzin Merchant

programme.title: Thanks for the Memories
programme.desc: Joyce is happy staying with her father while her boyfriend Conor is in Brussels, but cannot understand why she can suddenly speak Italian. Noticing the unspoken attraction between her and Justin, Joyce's boss at the radio station invites him to an office outing at the karaoke evening in the local pub

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The NHS: A People's History
programme.desc: Alex Brooker presents this three-part documentary in which patients and staff dig out treasured mementos to tell personal stories about the National Health Service. They include the newly qualified medic who was thrown into surgery on the NHS's first day, the doctor who invented a device that revolutionised hip replacement surgery and a booklet of medical fees proving a stark reminder of life before the NHS

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: A look at the lost world of coal mining and the social and cultural lives of those who worked in what was once Britain's most important industry, using footage from the 1940s to the 80s. With contributions by those who worked underground, lived in the pit villages and people who have been inspired by the coalfield culture, such as Billy Elliot writer Lee Hall. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: The Producers (1968)
programme.desc: A crooked Broadway producer and his neurotic accountant discover they can make a fortune by putting on a play that closes on opening night, then pocketing the unspent budget. The duo set out to put on the worst show of all time - a tasteless little number called Springtime for Hitler written by a deranged former Nazi. Mel Brooks' comedy, starring Zero Mostel, Gene Wilder and Kenneth Mars

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: A young gay man arrives in New York in the summer of 1969, when homosexuality is still illegal. He is drawn to Stonewall, the wild haunt of fabulous drag queens

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: The amateur cameraman's quest to find a newborn red deer calf is interrupted by sightings of a red-legged partridge herding her brood to safety, a sparrow feeding on a privet hawk-moth and a family of stoats. Finally he visits the Exmoor Pony Centre to learn how to ride a horse

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: The wildlife film-maker manages to buy the land his badger hide is on, but his excitement is overshadowed by worries about his three-legged pet deer, whose back leg is getting worse. As he tries to accept she may be nearing the end of her life, the villagers ask him to open their local flower show

programme.title: From Ice to Fire: The Incredible Science of Temperature
programme.desc: Helen Czerski explores the science of heat, and how the ability to harness it has led to some of humanity's greatest innovations, from steam engines to plasmas

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: A look at the lost world of coal mining and the social and cultural lives of those who worked in what was once Britain's most important industry, using footage from the 1940s to the 80s. With contributions by those who worked underground, lived in the pit villages and people who have been inspired by the coalfield culture, such as Billy Elliot writer Lee Hall. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Take That present an edition first broadcast on 25 December 1994, featuring studio performances and videos from D:Ream, Doop, Stiltskin, Wet Wet Wet, Mariah Carey, Let Loose, Whigfield and East 17

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Wright and Andy Peebles present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 28 June 1984. Featuring the Bluebells, Human League, Bob Marley & the Wailers, Alison Moyet, Scritti Politti and Frankie Goes To Hollywood

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Noel Edmonds looks at the weekly pop chart from 1977 and introduces John Miles, Hot Chocolate, Jesse Green, Cliff Richard, Queen and Legs & Co

programme.title: Elton John: Live at Wembley 1977
programme.desc: Coverage of the concert from the Empire Pool, Wembley, first broadcast in November 1977, which famously saw Elton announcing his retirement from live touring. Using extra footage from the BBC archive, this longer version of the show is being screened for the first time, restoring performances of songs like Bennie and the Jets, Don't Let the Sun Go Down on Me and Don't Go Breaking My Heart. This new extended version also sees Elton joined onstage by fellow music legend Stevie Wonder for a rare guest appearance

programme.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
programme.desc: Concert footage of Blondie performing live at the height of their powers in 1979 at the Apollo Theatre in Glasgow, with Debbie Harry wowing the audience with such hits as Dreaming, Union City Blue, Atomic, Picture This, Heart of Glass, Hanging on the Telephone and Sunday Girl

programme.title: Manic Street Preachers at Blackwood Miners' Institute
programme.desc: Highlights of Manic Street Preachers' 2011 homecoming gig at Blackwood Miners' Institute in Wales, the first time they had played in their home town of Blackwood for over 25 years

programme.title: Texas with the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra
programme.desc: The band join forces with the 60-piece BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra at Glasgow's Barrowland in an event recorded for BBC Music Day in 2017. Vic Galloway introduces the collaboration, which includes performances of Black Eyed Boy, Summer Son and I Don't Want a Lover

programme.title: Sparks: 6 Music Festival
programme.desc: Brothers Ron and Russell Mael take to the stage in 2017 to bring four decades worth of hits to Glasgow's O2 Academy

programme.title: The Making of Elton John: Madman Across the Water
programme.desc: The story of the Middlesex-born singer's formative years, including his childhood, his first break in the British music business and his rise to stardom on both sides of the Atlantic in the 1970s. As well as interviews with the singer himself, the programme also features the memories of colleagues and collaborators including lyricist Bernie Taupin and Leon Russell, with whom he worked on 2010 album The Union

programme.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
programme.desc: Concert footage of Blondie performing live at the height of their powers in 1979 at the Apollo Theatre in Glasgow, with Debbie Harry wowing the audience with such hits as Dreaming, Union City Blue, Atomic, Picture This, Heart of Glass, Hanging on the Telephone and Sunday Girl

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon meets the owner of a traditional wooden house in Barbados who has turned down millions of dollars from luxury property developers, then encounters marijuana growers on the volcanic island of St Vincent hoping that the drug will soon be decriminalised. On the South American mainland, Simon examines the mismanagement of Venezuela's natural resources, before crossing into Colombia, where he spends time with the Kogi - an indigenous people who have maintained their traditional forest lifestyle

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose visits Ecuador to examine the tale of an 18th-century expedition in which a group of French intellectuals set out to determine the shape of the Earth. The mission was beset by problems from the start as disease, disputes and affairs set the explorers on separate paths and, while great discoveries were made, the team was still to face theft, death and despair

programme.title: Beck

programme.desc: Chelcea's biggest passion is for hair! In this documentary, she shows us how she does her hair at home, doing her own hair, her mum's hair, her sister's hair, her friend's hair and even her dad's beard. Shemhas been doing lots of different hairstyles for everyone, inlcuding twists, braids (thick and small), plaits, tops buns, and also leaving it out as an afro, which is really good for the hair and scalp. Chelcea is an expert on the science of hair and how to look after it, and is particularity interested in natural hair remedies. Chelcea's parents encourage their daughter's passion and, through beautiful animation, we learn about her mum's childhood in the Democratic Republic of Congo. programme.desc: Old Jack tells a story to his faithful companion Salty dog about the day Sheena the Shrimp's musical rock broke

programme.title: Gecko's Garage
programme.desc: Gecko takes an old sofa to the rubbish dump.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels learn about art

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels and Duggee practise playing golf

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Messy joins Zim and his friends on a mission inside a sandwich to photograph some atoms for Mayor Oki... Everyone say cheese!

programme.title: Bitz & Bob
programme.desc: Bob can't go to his friend Phoebe's party because she has measles. This puts a stop to his aim to try and beat his previous record of shooting 4 basketball hoops in a row. Bitz decides to throw the best beach party ever to make up for it. There are snacks, games, a dance floor and even a basketball hoop! But it's a very warm day and soon everyone is too hot to party. Will they have to give up and call it a day or can Bitz find a way to cool everyone down so that Bob can try and beat his record?

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster arrives at the Lost Things Office ready to help Elder Bunny try and reunite the citizens of Fluffytown with possessions they might have lost.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Seeing the green covered in litter left after the previous day's Woo Hoo Day celebrations, Love Monster decides to clean it up

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The four adventure-seeking superheroes must try to stop some runaway Chinese drums as they roll towards the Forbidden City

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Grandmaster Glitch's digging floods Wieliczka Saltmine. The Go Jetters must save the famous salt statues

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Dog and Pug meet Little Red Riding Hood and the Big Bad Wolf.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits Theatre, it’s the speedy dancing runner beans, who won’t stand still for even one minute.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Mr Tumble makes breakfast for Tumble Ted. Meanwhile, Justin and his friends are collecting eggs for their breakfast

programme.title: Ranger Hamza's Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how blackbirds play an important role in the environment. They find out that blackbirds can adapt to living in the city by eating what they find and changing their song so it is heard above the city noise. They also learn that blackbirds recycle their nests and help plants grow in new places. On the way, they enjoy a picnic and try to spot blackbirds with their binoculars.

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Mack’s stall. She chooses the small thistle and remembers the day she got it… While admiring the display on Bob’s stall, James mentions to Alice that it’s a shame men tend not to be given flowers as gifts. This gets Alice thinking, and she asks James if she can borrow Molly to work on a special project later on that day. At closing time, James tries to guess what it is, but then he has a gift idea of his own. Molly becomes the go-between, trying to keep both gifts a secret, but it’s not easy! Will Molly be able to stop Alice and James accidentally bumping into each other and ruining each other’s surprise?

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Introducing the letter M as the ever-munching M and friends make a gingerbread man and chase after him on a flying mat - using a handy map to keep them hot on his trail

programme.title: Pfffirates
programme.desc: Pat and Stede accuse Lily of taking decisions too lightly, making her doubt herself

programme.title: What's in Your Bag
programme.desc: Opera singer Abigail shows us how she uses her vocal straw to warm up her voice before singing.

programme.title: Gigglebiz
programme.desc: Professor Muddles creates a machine to make himself young again, while sports reporter Keith Fitt attempts to break another world record

programme.title: Andy and the Band
programme.desc: Mac's Aunty needs the Odd Socks' help to get rid of some troublesome ghosts from her spooky guest house. The band's stint as ghost hunters leads to a surprisingly noisy discovery

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: Toodloo, Chickedy and Chick have fun on a roundabout, but Great BigHoo spins them out of control. They are later visited by the Stop-Go Car

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Looking at iconic songs that represent the varied music of Black artists from Nina Simone to Bob Marley at various locations around the UK with links to Black history. Tianah and Semhar are on Blackfriars Bridge to look at Nina Simone's Young, Gifted and Black

programme.title: Dipdap
programme.desc: The Line causes problems when Dip Dap becomes sleepy and tries to doze off in bed

programme.title: Treasure Champs
programme.desc: Barry is upset after losing a football match

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Tomato paints himself green and goes undercover as a Mini Pea to discover how Evil Pea is firing them at Tato Tower. He makes an unexpected new Mini Pea friend

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum reminisces about Bluey and Judo as babies

programme.title: Andy's Prehistoric Adventures
programme.desc: When disaster strikes at the National museum, Andy sets off on a prehistoric adventure using his trusty, time travelling clock

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know?
programme.desc: Maddie learns about clouds and rain and discovers how a radiator is made

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Evie and Doug enjoy their first playdate together with their friends. They try out their new ball pit, but Waffle cannot join in because he's not toilet trained and he has to find fun elsewhere

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran have their own carnival in the garden to celebrate St Lucia.

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: The adventurous duo plant some seeds after getting them for free in a newspaper

programme.title: Charlie and Lola
programme.desc: Charlie grows a tomato plant, so Lola decides to sow a seed too

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Tomo is coming around for a playdate and Tee finds that waiting patiently for his friend to arrive is very difficult. Maybe Mo’s idea to build a lookout den will help pass the time.

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Small, wearing a rainbow striped scarf, catches seven coloured stones floating in space. The Iron Chicken has also found a strange metal disc something in space. Do the stones and the disc somehow fit? The answer lies in the colours of the scarf

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Everyone is enjoying a ride on the Pinky Ponk, but Tombliboo Ooo is more interested in drinking all the Pinky Ponk juice. Inevitably his tummy is too full, so Tombliboo Unn and Tombliboo Eee help him to bed and play music to make him feel better.

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Chris Hoy reads Giraffe on a Bicycle

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Vick Hope host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A father goes into cardiac arrest after risking his life battling a house fire. A mountain biker misjudges his take-off during a competition, with devastating consequences

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven celebrates the beauty of the north Cornwall coast, and Steve Brown visits Warwickshire to investigate how the summer heatwave is crippling crops of peas and carrots

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of properties in Alfreton in Derbyshire, Brightlingsea in Essex and Maidstone in Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Norfolk's largest antiques centre, joined by experts Mark Stacey and Caroline Hawley, who chats about her collection of favourite things

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: An update on Hazel, the first southern koala born in Europe. There's another milestone for this precious baby, she has to be separated from her mother by the keepers for a short period. This is to ensure the keepers earn the baby's trust before she becomes impossible to work with. Their intention is to separate Hazel from her mother for 10 minutes without distressing either of the animals. Plus, a specialist osteopath attends a monitor lizard suffering a worrying issue with his spine

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore heads to Scotland's east coast on the lookout for quality discards at Wallyford Recycling Centre. There's an unwanted armchair to be rescued with the help of upcycler Sarah Peterson, a retro chest of drawers gets some loving attention from sign-writer Joel Poole and Sarah herself stops a collection of coffee jars from smashing in the skips

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton takes an Edinburgh couple on a house search of the Cotswolds, where they have £1million to spend on their new home. The presenter also visits a farm adopting bygone methods to grow sustainable and environmentally friendly crops

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam design an Asian-inspired garden in Fleet with lots of colourful plants and a nod to the tropical gardens of the owner's Taiwanese heritage

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott delight in Devonshire, where cream teas and antique treasures are on the menu. Amid the local ships, the pair dig up some wooden toys, prized pottery and very shiny things to sell. Irita visits an antiques emporium that's so new, it hasn't even opened yet and also gets her hands on something that brings back happy memories of childhood. Raj, meanwhile, heads off to hear the story of one of the great adventurers of the 20th century, as told by the son of the great man himself

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Lauren Laverne

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Elaine is determined to make things right between George and his daughters. Zack gets more than he bargained for when he caters a special night at the Prince Albert. Ben and Jay face some teething issues as they co-parent Lexi

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: The Wrights are in Scotland, starting out in the Cairngorns National Park, where Josh chooses to go bungee jumping - knowing full well that brother Mark has a fear of heights. Next up is a ride through the countryside on Segway scooters, but the brothers' rivalry comes to the fore once more and it turns into an insane race. Things become a little more relaxed when they spend the night in an idyllic cabin on the shores of Loch Lomond, followed by a fishing trip. But will any of them make a catch?

programme.title: NHS at 75: Wales Today Special
programme.desc: Nick Servini presents a special programme looking back at the NHS's first 75 years and asking how the service will fare in the future

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents topical debate from Exeter. This week's panel comprises Health and Social Care Minister Helen Whately MP, Shadow Mental Health Minister Dr Rosena Allin-Khan MP, the Scottish National Party's Deputy Leader at Westminster Mhairi Black MP, Daily Telegraph columnist Dia Chakravarty and the chef and campaigner Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A rota of BBC journalists, such as Adam Fleming and Chris Mason, contribute to the weekly round-up from Westminster. Collectively, they deliver their usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip concerning the biggest stories in politics

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Michelle Ackerley host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: An adrenaline-fuelled jump from a bridge goes terribly wrong, sparking a multi-agency rescue to retrieve an injured woman from icy water. Two young siblings call 999 after their mother has a seizure, leaving her injured and confused

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: In Herefordshire, Jules Hudson discovers why a good dose of country air might not be all that it's cracked up to be. John Craven enjoys the breathtaking north Cornwall coast, and Paul Martin is in Bannau Brycheiniog helping a mission to save Britain's most endangered mammal - the water vole

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of a three-bedroom terrace in Rugby, a former working men's club in Bolsover and a semi-detached in Nottingham

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Kingston Antiques Centre, and explores the home of the Wimbledon tennis championships. With experts Charles Hanson and Thomas Forrester

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest joins forces with Flambeau to search for a lost treasure in a 15th-century castle. Crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, with Mark Williams and John Light

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Longleat's tiger breeding programme has been a huge success with a male and female born three years ago. The precious cubs are now almost fully grown, and nearing the age when they could be separated to start their own families. The keepers now want to assess the male's strength, and determine if he has developed enough to cope on his own should he be moved to another breeding programme so have built a massive spring to test the father and son's strength. Plus, wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin tries to capture some shots of the latest addition to the park - a two-toed sloth

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a first-time buyer from Birmingham to find a home in the Shropshire countryside, and helps out by pulling pints for the locals at a community-owned pub

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull come up with designs for an overgrown garden in the Shropshire town of Telford that is little more than a pile of rubble, drawing inspiration from the travels of owners Rhi and Alex

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott embrace their inner pirate as they plunder the shops of the Cornish peninsula. Raj makes some big finds in one of the tiniest shops of the trip and pins his hopes on a risky item that may or may not be highly collectable. Irita plumps for a very cheap purchase and finds a painting that reminds her of her childhood and also contains a hidden secret. Along the way there's still time for some sightseeing, kite-flying and, of course, pirate impressions. The pair then head to the final auction to see who will emerge victorious

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Lauren Laverne

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Wynne Evans delves into the BBC Wales archive of 1978, remembering the wet summer, the start of Radio Wales and Ray Reardon's World Snooker Championship win. Other highlights include weird and wonderful dancing potatoes, cowboys in mid Wales and Aberystwuth actor Gareth Thomas leading the TV sci-fi adventure Blake's 7. Plus, a seal-hugging police officer, Betty Campbell in Tiger Bay and Shakin' Stevens in colour

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the conclusion of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes. The guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Satirist, presenter and producer Munya Chawawa, comedian Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and radio presenter Snoochie Shy join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee's lifestyle catches up on him and he is forced to wait on a hospital ward for routine surgery on his gallbladder until his blood pressure comes down. But visits from the parents-in-law and Anna and Toby, who arrive to ask him a question he doesn't want to hear, ensure that his stress levels remain dangerously high. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Georgie's golden child of a brother, Prince Freddie - the heir to the British throne - pays an unexpected visit with some unwelcome news from their parents. Furious, she runs off and is nowhere to be found, prompting Freddie and her staff to embark on a frantic search for the missing monarch. Catherine Tate and Daniel Lapaine star

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Heat (2013)
programme.desc: An uptight, ambitious FBI agent is sent to Boston to bring a notorious drug kingpin to justice. She ends up forced to team up with a rebellious, foul-mouthed local police detective who has a very different attitude to law enforcement but shares her inability to work with others. Action comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Melissa McCarthy

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Paul Ainsworth and Angela Hartnett, plus special guest Les Dennis. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: In the third episode, Nadiya Hussain shares some of her favourite savoury dishes, including a chicken and pink peppercorn pie, and simple, baked teriyaki noodles which are the perfect fuss-free midweek meal. Nadiya also demonstrates how to make a tear and share bread loaf with all the flavours of a pizza

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Tennis: Eastbourne
programme.desc: The Rothesay International Eastbourne Tennis Tournament. Live coverage of the final of the women's grass court tournament from Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club. Two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova took the honours here last year, prevailing 6-3, 6-2 against 2-17 French Open-winner Jelena Ostapenko

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph presents the show from High Wycombe recycling centre, where the experts set to work restoring a pine wardrobe, a pair of old sun loungers, and two metal garden chairs

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young Essex couple need Nicki Chapman's help to find them a new home in Somerset. Nicki also visits a local farm to sample some homemade specialities made from an ancient grain

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public, including an anatomy model, a set of antique printing drawers and a 1950s toy telephone

programme.title: Planet Earth Live
programme.desc: Cameras follow the struggles of Gremlin, a nine-week-old baby toque macaque born into a troop living among temple ruins in northern Sri Lanka. In order to survive, the youngster must learn to negotiate predators and face the threat posed by rival monkeys known as the Slumdogs. Julia Bradbury narrates

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean rewinds the quirkiest clips from half a century of Welsh television. This time, she heads back to the future to see how the nation has been ahead of its time, from building dancing robots to inventing musical instruments

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Across three rounds, best friends from Reading and Norfolk, a mother and daughter from London and siblings from Belfast have their knowledge put to the test

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night game show, as contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. Helping today's contestants out are Claudia Winkleman, Big Narstie, Alex Brooker, Gabby Logan, Debbie McGee, Jamie Laing and Patrick Grant

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz, as Jamie Laing, James Argent, Griff Rhys Jones, Nina Wadia, Lee Latchford Evans, Claire Richards, Sindhu Vee and Tiff Stevenson try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Rumours of Jodie's apparent affair with Max spiral out of control, forcing her to resign. However, her leaving party ends in disaster when the pub explodes. Donna struggles to keep control of the new nurses and worries she isn't a good enough role model for them, but Rida and Cam prove her wrong

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Drama created by bestselling novelist Candice Carty-Williams, about the rivalry between brother and sister rappers. Talented songwriter Vita supports her brother Bosco as he strives to rebuild his musical career following a prison sentence. However, she comes to realise he will never appreciate what she does for him, and decides to strike out on her own as a solo artist. Starring Déja J Bowens and Malcolm Kamulete

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: PS I Love You (2007)
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Good Vibrations (2012)
programme.desc: A music lover in 1970s Belfast opens a record shop while his city is torn apart by the Troubles. His business introduces him to the city's underground punk scene, and he becomes one of the key figures in creating an alternative subculture to the violence around him. Fact-based drama, starring Richard Dormer, Jodie Whittaker, Liam Cunningham and Dylan Moran
