programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: An adrenaline-fuelled jump from a bridge goes terribly wrong, sparking a multi-agency rescue to retrieve an injured woman from icy water. Two young siblings call 999 after their mother has a seizure, leaving her injured and confused

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: In Herefordshire, Jules Hudson discovers why a good dose of country air might not be all that it's cracked up to be. John Craven enjoys the breathtaking north Cornwall coast, and Paul Martin is in Bannau Brycheiniog helping a mission to save Britain's most endangered mammal - the water vole

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of properties in Alfreton in Derbyshire, Brightlingsea in Essex and Maidstone in Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Kingston Antiques Centre, and explores the home of the Wimbledon tennis championships. With experts Charles Hanson and Thomas Forrester

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest joins forces with Flambeau to search for a lost treasure in a 15th-century castle. Crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, with Mark Williams and John Light

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Longleat's tiger breeding programme has been a huge success with a male and female born three years ago. The precious cubs are now almost fully grown, and nearing the age when they could be separated to start their own families. The keepers now want to assess the male's strength, and determine if he has developed enough to cope on his own should he be moved to another breeding programme so have built a massive spring to test the father and son's strength. Plus, wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin tries to capture some shots of the latest addition to the park - a two-toed sloth

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a first-time buyer from Birmingham to find a home in the Shropshire countryside, and helps out by pulling pints for the locals at a community-owned pub

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull come up with designs for an overgrown garden in the Shropshire town of Telford that is little more than a pile of rubble, drawing inspiration from the travels of owners Rhi and Alex

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott embrace their inner pirate as they plunder the shops of the Cornish peninsula. Raj makes some big finds in one of the tiniest shops of the trip and pins his hopes on a risky item that may or may not be highly collectable. Irita plumps for a very cheap purchase and finds a painting that reminds her of her childhood and also contains a hidden secret. Along the way there's still time for some sightseeing, kite-flying and, of course, pirate impressions. The pair then head to the final auction to see who will emerge victorious

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Lauren Laverne

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: Harry from Newcastle embarks on his first pigeon racing season. Inspired by his father's love of the birds, he is going to see if he can rear a team of winners and take on the more mature members of the South Gosforth Homing Society

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond and the team are at Ingliston for the Royal Highland Show, with Cammy Wilson following all the action from the Golden Shears World Championship, which is being held at the event for the first time. Arlene Stuart meets members of the Highland Pony Society as they celebrate their centenary, and Dougie finds out about the farmers' initiative that's donating pick-up trucks to the Ukrainian front line

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the conclusion of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes. The guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee's lifestyle catches up on him and he is forced to wait on a hospital ward for routine surgery on his gallbladder until his blood pressure comes down. But visits from the parents-in-law and Anna and Toby, who arrive to ask him a question he doesn't want to hear, ensure that his stress levels remain dangerously high. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Georgie's golden child of a brother, Prince Freddie - the heir to the British throne - pays an unexpected visit with some unwelcome news from their parents. Furious, she runs off and is nowhere to be found, prompting Freddie and her staff to embark on a frantic search for the missing monarch. Catherine Tate and Daniel Lapaine star

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Heat (2013)
programme.desc: An uptight, ambitious FBI agent is sent to Boston to bring a notorious drug kingpin to justice. She ends up forced to team up with a rebellious, foul-mouthed local police detective who has a very different attitude to law enforcement but shares her inability to work with others. Action comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Melissa McCarthy

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: In the third episode, Nadiya Hussain shares some of her favourite savoury dishes, including a chicken and pink peppercorn pie, and simple, baked teriyaki noodles which are the perfect fuss-free midweek meal. programme.title: Tennis: Eastbourne
programme.desc: The Rothesay International Eastbourne Tennis Tournament. Live coverage of the final of the women's grass court tournament from Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club. programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph presents the show from High Wycombe recycling centre, where the experts set to work restoring a pine wardrobe, a pair of old sun loungers, and two metal garden chairs

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young Essex couple need Nicki Chapman's help to find them a new home in Somerset. Nicki also visits a local farm to sample some homemade specialities made from an ancient grain

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public, including an anatomy model, a set of antique printing drawers and a 1950s toy telephone

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Kim's relatives live all over the world, and when they do visit, they avoid gathering in Kim's tired, unloved garden. This prompts Flo Headlam and Charlie Dimmock to head to Luton, Bedfordshire, to create a cottage garden for Kim who has a budget of £4,000 to make the most of the outdoor space

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Across three rounds, best friends from Reading and Norfolk, a mother and daughter from London and siblings from Belfast have their knowledge put to the test

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night game show, as contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. Helping today's contestants out are Claudia Winkleman, Big Narstie, Alex Brooker, Gabby Logan, Debbie McGee, Jamie Laing and Patrick Grant

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz, as Jamie Laing, James Argent, Griff Rhys Jones, Nina Wadia, Lee Latchford Evans, Claire Richards, Sindhu Vee and Tiff Stevenson try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Rumours of Jodie's apparent affair with Max spiral out of control, forcing her to resign. However, her leaving party ends in disaster when the pub explodes. Donna struggles to keep control of the new nurses and worries she isn't a good enough role model for them, but Rida and Cam prove her wrong

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Drama created by bestselling novelist Candice Carty-Williams, about the rivalry between brother and sister rappers. Talented songwriter Vita supports her brother Bosco as he strives to rebuild his musical career following a prison sentence. However, she comes to realise he will never appreciate what she does for him, and decides to strike out on her own as a solo artist. Starring Déja J Bowens and Malcolm Kamulete

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: PS I Love You (2007)
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Good Vibrations (2012)
programme.desc: A music lover in 1970s Belfast opens a record shop while his city is torn apart by the Troubles. His business introduces him to the city's underground punk scene, and he becomes one of the key figures in creating an alternative subculture to the violence around him. Fact-based drama, starring Richard Dormer, Jodie Whittaker, Liam Cunningham and Dylan Moran

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Vick Hope host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A father goes into cardiac arrest after risking his life battling a house fire. A mountain biker misjudges his take-off during a competition, with devastating consequences

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven celebrates the beauty of the north Cornwall coast, and Steve Brown visits Warwickshire to investigate how the summer heatwave is crippling crops of peas and carrots

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of properties in Alfreton in Derbyshire, Brightlingsea in Essex and Maidstone in Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Norfolk's largest antiques centre, joined by experts Mark Stacey and Caroline Hawley, who chats about her collection of favourite things

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: An update on Hazel, the first southern koala born in Europe. There's another milestone for this precious baby, she has to be separated from her mother by the keepers for a short period. This is to ensure the keepers earn the baby's trust before she becomes impossible to work with. Their intention is to separate Hazel from her mother for 10 minutes without distressing either of the animals. Plus, a specialist osteopath attends a monitor lizard suffering a worrying issue with his spine

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore heads to Scotland's east coast on the lookout for quality discards at Wallyford Recycling Centre. There's an unwanted armchair to be rescued with the help of upcycler Sarah Peterson, a retro chest of drawers gets some loving attention from sign-writer Joel Poole and Sarah herself stops a collection of coffee jars from smashing in the skips

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton takes an Edinburgh couple on a house search of the Cotswolds, where they have £1million to spend on their new home. The presenter also visits a farm adopting bygone methods to grow sustainable and environmentally friendly crops

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam design an Asian-inspired garden in Fleet with lots of colourful plants and a nod to the tropical gardens of the owner's Taiwanese heritage

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott delight in Devonshire, where cream teas and antique treasures are on the menu. Amid the local ships, the pair dig up some wooden toys, prized pottery and very shiny things to sell. Irita visits an antiques emporium that's so new, it hasn't even opened yet and also gets her hands on something that brings back happy memories of childhood. Raj, meanwhile, heads off to hear the story of one of the great adventurers of the 20th century, as told by the son of the great man himself

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Lauren Laverne

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Elaine is determined to make things right between George and his daughters. Zack gets more than he bargained for when he caters a special night at the Prince Albert. Ben and Jay face some teething issues as they co-parent Lexi

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: The Wrights are in Scotland, starting out in the Cairngorns National Park, where Josh chooses to go bungee jumping - knowing full well that brother Mark has a fear of heights. Next up is a ride through the countryside on Segway scooters, but the brothers' rivalry comes to the fore once more and it turns into an insane race. Things become a little more relaxed when they spend the night in an idyllic cabin on the shores of Loch Lomond, followed by a fishing trip. But will any of them make a catch?

programme.title: Community Life
programme.desc: Barra Best presents more stories of people who make others' lives better, trying his hand at medieval sword fighting with a group on Belfast's Donegall Pass. Anne Marie Wallace spends time with a team caring for homeless dogs, Cate Conway meets the barber whose classes are helping turn young lives around and Jo Scott takes on Newry's answer to the Road Runner

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents topical debate from Exeter. This week's panel comprises Health and Social Care Minister Helen Whately MP, Shadow Mental Health Minister Dr Rosena Allin-Khan MP, the Scottish National Party's Deputy Leader at Westminster Mhairi Black MP, Daily Telegraph columnist Dia Chakravarty and the chef and campaigner Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A rota of BBC journalists, such as Adam Fleming and Chris Mason, contribute to the weekly round-up from Westminster. Collectively, they deliver their usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip concerning the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Creations of the Swansea Yarnbombers adorn postboxes across the Welsh city. This group of women, united by their passion for woolly creations, routinely sneak out under cover of darkness. Their work might appear on a park bench or decorate a tree, but this warm-hearted documentary follows them as they face their biggest challenge - decorating Mumbles pier

programme.desc: Gregor MacLeod and his trusted bakers and cooks share their favourite recipes inspired by countries afar. programme.title: Sgeulachd Cogaidh na h-Artaig/Untold Arctic Wars
programme.desc: Documentary series that reveals the big picture of events in the Arctic during the Second World War. It shows the importance of the battles in that arena for the course of events for the war in general. The series dives deep into secret events and agreements between different parties, revealing the world-class game played in the Arctic. From the history research point of view, the Arctic is a gold mine - the area was a playground for a big political thriller centring around natural resources vital for the war industry

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Caroline's father Henry suggests turning off her life-support machine, presenting Dr Ormerod with a dilemma. Goodwin puts his career on the line by allowing a holistic therapist to treat a back injury and student nurse Samantha Beaumont is less than impressed by a date with theatre technician Alun Morris. Medical drama, starring Robert Daws, Michael Jayston and Amy Robbins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Goodwin's medical skills are brought into question when he wrongly accuses a cafe of making a local jazz band ill and a dinner party turns murderous for Ormerod and Weatherill when their host reveals his wife is trying to kill him. The Health Authority announce plans to reorganise management at the Royal, leaving Mr Harper less than keen to reapply for his job, so Ken and Alun hit upon a plan to convince him otherwise

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Tricia is over the moon as she and Mike finally declare their love for one another - but gets drawn into a case of domestic violence before she has chance to celebrate, and ends up fighting for her life. Starring Clare Calbraith and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Dr Tricia Summerbee tries to get back to normal following her near-fatal heart attack, despite Mike's concerns that she has returned to work too soon. Elsewhere, Ventress investigates a murder in the village - and gets a shock when the prime suspect turns out to be a thief he certified dead more than 15 years earlier. Jason Durr, Clare Calbraith and William Simons star

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Viv's plans to hold a party for Jean's first birthday go to waste when Zoe upsets Scott and Jack, prompting both to resign. Meanwhile, Marlon takes steps to coax Tricia round

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Scott vows to have his say after Zoe snubs him in the street. Meanwhile, Andy tells Jack his help is not required

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: News of Richard's confession has the residents in turmoil - not least Ashley, who is devastated to discover the man who spoke so movingly at Maxine's funeral is her killer

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail finally plucks up the courage to return home, just as Ashley is doing the same, and Eileen is shocked by the appearance of a familiar face in the Rovers

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls victim to depression after failing to prevent the murder of a society girl by notorious art thief Marrascaud. His confidence shattered, Poirot eventually returns to work when a lonely chauffeur begs him to find his missing soulmate, the maid of a famous Russian dancer. The investigation takes him to the Swiss Alps, where, against all odds, he stumbles upon a hotel thought to be Marrascaud's hideout - leading to a very personal showdown. The penultimate episode of the long-running detective drama, starring David Suchet, with Simon Callow, Orla Brady, Patrick Ryecart, Nigel Lindsay, Morven Christie, Tom Austen and Rupert Evans

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The village is plagued by a spate of burglaries, and the finger of suspicion points to a most unlikely perpetrator, revealing a heartbreaking tale of domestic abuse and family tragedy. Elsewhere, Vernon resolves to dig out his books on hypnotism and put an end to Gina's arachnophobia, but his early experiments on David leave his patient feeling rather peculiar, while Dennis and Jenny discover a mutual love of jazz

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The County Sheepdog Trials take place at Ashfordly Hall, and it soon becomes clear that even such a prestigious event can bring out the worst in some people. Meanwhile, Vernon tries to cash in by organising the toilet facilities for the event - but his money-making dreams soon go down the pan

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victim's story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star in the murder mystery

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks, Devlin and Chandler investigate after a man is found badly beaten in a park. They discover the victim, Roland Kirk - who lives in a nearby camper van - had many enemies in the community, but nobody is willing to talk. The case then takes a decisive turn when a local man capitulates after being arrested and points the finger at architect Harry Morgan, whose son had recently turned against him and aligned himself with Kirk. Kevin McNally guest stars, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Harriet Walter

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth investigates the murder of her old friend Father Gorman, using a list of names sent by the priest moments before his death to bring the guilty party to justice. Following a trail of clues to London, Marple is drawn to the Pale Horse Inn - where she discovers a sinister world of occult practices. Drama, starring Julia McKenzie in the title role, with Lynda Baron, Pauline Collins, Nicholas Parsons and Neil Pearson

programme.title: Princess Diana: A Life After Death
programme.desc: Diana, Princess of Wales' death set the British nation thinking about the monarchy, and a strange atmosphere existed throughout the nation in the unstable summer of 1997. Prime minister Tony Blair had just won an election with a landslide majority and the tabloid press were pursuing Diana everywhere. Events were already leading to a full-scale crisis and the sudden and unexpected death of Diana changed the country

Drama, starring Linda Armstrong, Polly Maberly and Robert Daws

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Goodwin comes to the aid of a man brought in with a leg injury which his friend claims was sustained in an agricultural accident, but it soon emerges he is actually suffering a gunshot wound - prompting his panic-stricken acquaintance to pull a revolver on the hospital staff. Meanwhile, Ormerod helps fossil collectors hurt in a landslide, Matron tries to convince Sister Brigid to return to work and student nurse Samantha Beaumont is less than impressed at the offer of a date with Alun Morris. Medical drama, starring Paul Fox, Tony Pitts, Denis Lill, Robert Daws and Wendy Craig

programme.desc: The village is plagued by a spate of burglaries, and the finger of suspicion points to a most unlikely perpetrator, revealing a heartbreaking tale of domestic abuse and family tragedy. programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Scott locks himself and Jean in a garage, refusing to come out until Zoe grants him visiting rights. Terry looks forward to coming home from hospital

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon contemplates life without Tricia, while at the hospital he faces a heart-rending decision. Later, Charity's charm irritates Zoe

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail and the family wonder if their lives will ever get back to normal as the press follow their every move, and Peter begs Tracy not to spill the beans about Lucy

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: With Shelley sobbing away, Peter braces himself for an emotional confession, while Gail hits the bottle as the pressure of being married to a known murderer takes its toll

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: David Suchet takes on his final case as the Belgian sleuth in the last-ever episode of the long-running drama. Crippled with arthritis, Poirot is now using a wheelchair and has a life-threatening heart condition, but remains as sharp as ever. Calling on old friend Captain Hastings for assistance, he returns to Styles, where the pair first met 30 years earlier on a murder investigation. The detective is convinced the country house is once again harbouring a killer, and as guests fall victim to a mysterious attacker, he must summon the last of his strength to battle his ultimate nemesis. With Hugh Fraser, Anne Reid, Philip Glenister, Helen Baxendale, Matthew McNulty, Anna Madeley and Shaun Dingwall

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Abandoned by his wife and faced with financial ruin, local farmer Richard Harvey finally reaches the end of his tether, and heads into Aidensfield to air his grievances in a particularly memorable way. Meanwhile, the arrival of a handsome stranger sets Gina's heart racing - but he could be a dangerous criminal. Vernon and David branch out into a new line of business, and soon manage to pep up a few palates with Aunt Beth's tangy horseradish sauce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy thinks he's pulled off quite a coup when he spies a dangerous armed robber, but the villain makes his escape and embarks on a desperate hunt for a fast car to steal. Meanwhile, Merton's singer-songwriter cousin arrives, looking for the peace and quiet she needs to work, but her pregnant daughter soon puts paid to that idea. Lulu guest stars

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa decides to leave for Spain with baby James and says an awkward goodbye to Martin, but when he finds the scan of her brain, he spots a malformation and realises she could suffer a haemorrhage if she gets on the plane. Will the doctor make it to the airport in time? Meanwhile, Margaret reveals the real reason she has come to Portwenn, and disaster strikes at Bert and Jennifer's engagement party when Caroline receives an electric shock

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: With Louisa visiting her mother in Spain to get some perspective on their marriage, Martin knows he needs to try to change for the sake of their relationship, so he endeavours to keep his promise to her to see a therapist. Aunt Ruth arranges an appointment for him with Dr Rachel Timoney, but a lifeboat training exercise causes problems for the doctor. Will he get back in time for his first session? Martin Clunes stars

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin are called to investigate when a man is attacked and his kidney is surgically removed. The focus quickly turns to finding the intended recipient of the organ, and the team is horrified to discover that it has been trafficked into the NHS and given to wealthy patient Joanna Woodleigh. When the case is handed over to the CPS, a conflict of interests becomes apparent as Steel and Phillips go up against George Castle in court. Denis Lawson guest stars, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Freema Agyeman

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate the death of middle-class teenager Debbie Powell. They discover the victim had been living a secret life as a drugs mule, and was being led astray by local dealer Gerry Craig. The case has an emotional impact on Castle, who demands Steel and Phillips do everything in their power to bring the person responsible to justice. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Bill Paterson star

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: A former bookie falls under suspicion for the murder of a hospital benefactor, who is found dead in his car. As the detectives investigate the case, it becomes clear their prime suspect had a strong motive, believing the victim was responsible for putting his daughter into a coma. Brian Cox guest stars, with John Thaw and Kevin Whately

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George pushes Mildred to choose between him and the dog when he begins to resent the affection lavished upon her beloved pooch

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: An opera singer is shot by a sniper at an Oxford University ceremony just as she is about to receive an honorary degree. Morse is a big fan of her work and thinks she could not possibly be involved in anything untoward, but his investigations turn up more than a few sordid secrets. Detective drama, starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately, Robert Hardy, Sheila Gish, John Gielgud and Rachel Weisz

programme.title: Carry On Again Doctor (1969)
programme.desc: A disgraced surgeon sets up a clinic in the hope of promoting a supposedly miraculous slimming potion made from secret ingredients discovered on a remote tropical island. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Jim Dale, Barbara Windsor, Charles Hawtrey, Hattie Jacques, Pat Coombs and Joan Sims

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are asked to restore an ornate water garden cascade in the grounds of a health spa, where they are invited to join owner Frances Caldecott and her children for dinner. That evening, the duo discover Frances has been strangled and her jewellery stolen, and set out to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to cure a patchy lawn at a select language school hiding dark secrets. The disappearance of a Polish student alerts them to a tale of passion, rivalry and revenge, and when a handyman is found with his throat cut they race to find the killer. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective finds himself investigating the strange and gruesome murder of an elderly psychiatrist. Elsewhere, Poirot's old friend Ariadne Oliver is being pressed to uncover the truth behind two decade-old deaths. As the pair dig deep for evidence, they soon discover that their separate investigations are linked and join forces to solve the overarching mystery. David Suchet, Zoe Wanamaker and Greta Scacchi star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with sidekick Captain Hastings (Hugh Fraser), secretary Miss Lemon (Pauline Moran) and Inspector Japp (Philip Jackson) in a case that plunges him into the world of global espionage as the Second World War looms. The public are in panic after the shocking death of Russian grandmaster Ivan Savaranoff during a game of chess. Poirot must try to determine the good guys from the bad in a complex plot that sees the main figures used like pawns. David Suchet stars in a story adapted by Mark Gatiss and Ian Hallard

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with old friend Ariadne Oliver, who has been commissioned to stage a game of murder hunt at a summer fete in the grounds of Nasse House, the recently purchased home of wealthy financier Sir George Stubbs. However, the novelist's instincts tell her she's getting involved in something much darker - and she's proved right when the girl volunteering to play the part of the victim really does turn out to be dead. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Zoe Wanamaker, Sean Pertwee, Martin Jarvis, Sam Kelly, Sinead Cusack, Rosalind Ayres and Tom Ellis

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is found strangled. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing. Starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Cliff Parisi

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Members of the Midsomer-in-the-Marsh Ornithological Society fall out when Ralph Ford claims to have spotted a blue-crested hoopoe, meaning he wins the group's year-listing competition. However, their president Patrick Morgan says the rare species could never have been seen so far away from its native Uganda and brands him a cheat. The next day, Barnaby and Jones have a murder case on their hands when Patrick is found dead at the scene of the reported sighting. Guest starring Paul Nicholls and James Dreyfus

programme.title: The Suspicions of Mr Whicher
programme.desc: Another chance to see the second instalment of the crime drama starring Paddy Considine as the pioneering 19th-century inspector. Having left the Metropolitan Police under a cloud, Whicher's days as a detective are behind him. However, when he saves a respectable country lady from a violent robbery in a dangerous part of London, she hires him to investigate the savage murder of her 16-year-old niece. The investigation pits Whicher against wealthy and powerful figures, as well his former colleagues in the Met, and leads to a psychiatric institution where he must confront his own demons. Co-starring Olivia Colman, Shaun Dingwall and Mark Bazeley

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Crime drama following the personal and professional lives of two detectives working for a Manchester police unit that specialises in murder cases. DC Janet Scott (Lesley Sharp) and DC Rachel Bailey (Suranne Jones) investigate the case of a pregnant woman who was killed in her bedroom. Meanwhile, Rachel's love life takes a turn for the worse and Janet gets a call that reawakens a past tragedy. Also starring Rupert Graves, Amelia Bullmore and Nicholas Gleaves

Arthur finds himself immersed in the fracas, while simultaneously trying to take over the affairs of a steam-cleaning business. Light-hearted drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A series of robberies is committed on affluent couples travelling down a country lane, and it transpires two of the suspected offenders are wealthy themselves. Lesley-Anne Down guest stars alongside John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Simon visits the West Indies, but his excursion turns into an investigation into the murder of an old friend. Sixties drama, starring Roger Moore

programme.title: Dempsey and Makepeace
programme.desc: An international banker is held to ransom, providing Makepeace with an ideal opportunity to prove a point to her chauvinistic partner as she too gets caught up in the hostage situation. Michael Brandon and Glynis Barber star

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: How a homemade guitar amp changed the course of music history overnight and how a team of expert pen makers are giving a Second World War fighter a new lease of life

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: An old friend asks the wily detective to deliver a set of encyclopaedias - but there is more to the consignment than meets the eye. Drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: The Flying Squad foils the hijacking of a security truck before attempting to learn the identity of an informer. Colin Welland guest stars in the hard-hitting police drama, alongside John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur's car lot is threatened with closure, spurring him to enter the cut-and-thrust world of local politics to have more of a say in local issues. Comedy drama, starring Dennis Waterman, George Cole and Lennard Pearce, best remembered as Grandad in Only Fools and Horses

programme.title: Cycling: British National Road Race Championships
programme.desc: Highlights of the 2023 British male and female National Road Race Championship races from Saltburn, featuring leading domestic and international professional riders

programme.title: BattleBots
programme.desc: When a surprising twist blows the competition wide open, the world's greatest bots redouble their efforts to win a spot in the knockout round

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In an earlier investigation, Jeremy Wade was propelled into an Indian river by a goonch catfish as big as himself, yet managed to land the rare beast after an epic battle. Ten years on, Jeremy hears a report from neighbouring Nepal of a mysterious attack that sounds strangely familiar - a lone fisherman on a mountain river dragged off his feet and into the water by an unseen creature. The extreme angler contemplates whether the original river monster could be back, and sets off to find out

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave makes a weathervane in his metalwork class at school and tests it on the roof of Grimsby Heights - things go well until his assistant, Gran, gets struck by lightning. Charged with electrical powers, Dave must run Gran down like a battery before she causes too much mischief.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. While Mr Magoo prepares for a spin on his new boat (actually a shopping cart), he notices the Aerofizz in the distance - convinced that he's under attack from a ghost ship, Mr Magoo aims to defend the city at all costs.

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: Emilia Fox and criminologist Professor David Wilson focus on the disappearance of Suzy Lamplugh. The estate agent vanished after making an appointment with a client in July 1986. Despite the high profile of the case, nobody has ever been charged with Lamplugh's abduction and murder. Following a series of tantalising clues, Emilia and David narrow the field of suspects down to just one man. Will he reveal the truth?

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith and journalist Clive Entwistle describe the killers' trial in 1966, and recall the tension in court as they faced justice, including the moment when a tape recording of a girl being tortured was played. The film also documents Myra Hindley's life in prison, and her protracted, unsuccessful campaign to secure her parole

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo

Chester Zoo's extremely rare bald ibises produce a batch of new chicks, which are destined to be released back into the wild in southern Spain. There is also a chance to witness the reunion of rhino couple Beni and Asha, who have been kept separate for four years

programme.title: HMP Long Lartin: Evil Behind Bars
programme.desc: Documentary exploring life inside HMP Long Lartin in Evesham, Worcestershire, a maximum-security prison which holds some of Britain's most brutal criminals, the majority of which are serving life sentences. Some of its notorious inmates include the Suffolk Strangler, serial killer Steve Wright, who murdered five women, and Colin Ireland, the serial killer who killed five homosexual men. Female staff reveal what it's like to work around high-profile criminals who have killed women, ex-inmates share their stories of dealing and taking illegal drugs, as well as brewing up their home-made alcoholic drink called hooch and enjoying parties on the prison's wings

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of medical emergency teams in the A&E department of Barnsley Hospital. Paramedics rush in Dean, a 30-year-old who has been admitted after being in a serious motorbike collision and may have spinal injuries. programme.desc: Johnny Vegas presents a whistle-stop tour of awkward, embarrassing and cringeworthy holiday moments, as related by a selection of comedians and celebrities. Johnny's famous contributors skewer the traditional staycation, questioning the perks of rain-drenched British beaches, and whether anyone really likes going camping. Turning their attention further afield, the stars share some of their most memorable holiday tales, including transforming a hotel corridor into one long 'slip-and-slide', the suspicious discovery of a pair of chicken fillets in a swimming pool in Marbella, and a blush-inducing incident involving a naked paragliding session along a Spanish beachfront

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski visits Liverpool's two cathedrals, which lie at either end of Hope Street. In the opening edition, Sue is about to give birth to their 22nd child just as the nation goes into lockdown and when the latest addition arrives home, everyone else in the house must muck in

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: The Radford children return to education after months off due to the pandemic, and with 11-year-old Max starting at a new high school his parents anxiously wait to see how his first day went. programme.desc: Following engineers and designers as they race to construct the Seven Seas Explorer. Their aim is to make it the most luxurious ship of its type, designed to convey 750 passengers when others of its size would hold 5,000

programme.title: Princess Anne: Dignity and Duty
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the life of Princess Anne, the queen's only daughter. The programme examines her skill as a horse rider, representing Britain in three-day eventing at the 1976 Olympics on her mother's horse, as well as her support for various charities and foundations, and the incident in 1974, when she survived an attempt to kidnap her and hold her to ransom

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: A look at the history of Highgrove House in Gloucestershire, which is the family residence of the King Charles and Queen Camilla. The programme also hears from a witness to Prince Philip's 2019 car crash near Sandringham, which led to him handing in his driving licence

programme.title: Prince Edward: Will He Change the Royals?
programme.desc: Charting the life of the Duke of Edinburgh as he rose to become one of the most important members of the royal family, featuring archive footage and interviews with historians, royal insiders and journalists. The film looks at the prince' long and happy marriage to Sophie, Duchess of Edinburgh, as well as his decision to become a full-time working royal, and how his family have grounded him

programme.title: When Celebrity Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Contributors including Union J's Jaymi Hensley, Vanessa Feltz, Carole Malone, Adam Rickitt and Carol Decker recall the popstars, actors, comedians and even astronauts embroiled in everything from sex scandals to televised meltdowns. Unflattering episodes featured include Jimmy Carr's public shaming for tax avoidance, Naomi Campbell's blood diamond debacle, Justin Lee Collins's career-stopping harassment conviction and Leo Sayer's 'clean pants' rant in the Celebrity Big Brother house. Plus, Dustin Diamond, of Saved by the Bell fame, reveals the truth behind his ill-judged sex tape and veteran newsreader Ed Mitchell describes how alcoholism left him homeless

A combo dubbed Who's Counting Rivets hopes to impress the judges with a layout featuring gadgets galore, pyrotechnics and a multitude of mini-animations. Retired traditionalists the Three Millers plan to re-enact a dramatic railway scene from 1950s Holland, while the Titfield Thunderbolts attempt to stage an action adventure in the jungle involving a plane crash and a volcano. programme.desc: Confederate soldiers wipe out a group of Union troops carrying a shipment of gold, but later learn the Civil War ended the month before, rendering their attack a criminal act. The soldiers go on the run with the loot, but their worries deepen when they are besieged by bandits. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Richard Denning

programme.title: We're No Angels (1955)
programme.desc: Three convicts escape from the penal colony on notorious Devil's Island and seize a French family's shop - only to find themselves helping the storekeeper outwit his scheming relatives. Comedy, starring Humphrey Bogart, Peter Ustinov, Aldo Ray and Basil Rathbone

programme.title: Thunder Bay (1953)
programme.desc: A former Navy engineer comes up with a plan to establish an offshore oil drilling site on the Louisiana coast. However, his scheme is threatened by dangerous weather conditions, his own treacherous financial backers, and irate locals who fear for their fishing business. Action adventure, with James Stewart and Joanne Dru

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections

programme.title: Zathura: A Space Adventure (2005)
programme.desc: Two squabbling brothers with time on their hands decide to play a mysterious old board game after finding it in their basement. A chance roll of the dice sends their house into deep space, where they must battle with aliens and work together to stay alive. Family sci-fi adventure, starring Josh Hutcherson, Jonah Bobo, Kristen Stewart, Tim Robbins and Dax Shepard

programme.title: Black '47 (2018)
programme.desc: An Irish mercenary fighting for the British in 1847 abandons his post and returns home, hoping to be reunited with his family. However, he arrives home in the middle of the great famine, a disaster that proves even more harrowing than the horrors of war he has witnessed. Period drama, starring Hugo Weaving and James Frecheville

programme.title: Star Trek: First Contact (1996)
programme.desc: Captain Jean-Luc Picard and the crew of the Enterprise face their deadliest enemies, the Borg, who travel back in time in an attempt to change Earth's history. The starship follows on a mission to foil their plan, but the vessel is taken over by members of the cyborg collective, leaving Picard consumed by a desire for revenge. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner, James Cromwell and Alice Krige

programme.title: Star Trek: Insurrection (1998)
programme.desc: Captain Picard and the Enterprise crew uncover a conspiracy by their own superiors and a sinister alien race to take over a peaceful world and exploit its power to prolong life. However, the crew is forced to defy Federation orders and turns renegade to protect the planet's inhabitants. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Patrick Stewart, F Murray Abraham, Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner and Michael Dorn

programme.title: Strategic Air Command (1955)
programme.desc: A pilot relishes the opportunity to return to the baseball pitch once the Second World War is over. However, his sporting career is put on hold when he's drafted back into the US Air Force and given the opportunity to fly a revolutionary new jet. Drama, starring James Stewart, Frank Lovejoy, Barry Sullivan, Alex Nicol and June Allyson

programme.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture (1979)
programme.desc: A mysterious, planet-sized energy cloud is heading for Earth, destroying everything in its path. Admiral James T Kirk returns to the bridge of the Enterprise to stop the invader, but he has to contend with a bitter rival and the possession of one of his crew by the alien force. Sci-fi adventure, the first movie based on the TV series, starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley and Persis Khambatta

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo (2011)
programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse (2016)
programme.desc: The mutant heroes face the oldest and most powerful of their kind, an ancient Egyptian tyrant who is restored to life in the 1980s and plans to destroy civilisation and rebuild it in his own image. Awakening after thousands of years, he recruits the disheartened Magneto and other mutants to create a new world order. As the fate of Earth hangs in the balance, Professor X and Raven lead a team of young X-Men to stop their seemingly invincible nemesis from destroying mankind. Superhero adventure sequel, starring James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender, Jennifer Lawrence and Oscar Isaac

A scientist learns the world is soon to face a global cataclysm that will wipe out the human race, but finds the US president has plans to secretly save a fraction of the population, leaving everyone else to die. A writer learns of this scheme, and as the world is devastated by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, he tries to get his family to the last safe refuge. Disaster movie, with John Cusack and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: No One Lives (2012)
programme.desc: A gang of criminals kidnaps a couple and holds them hostage at an abandoned house in the middle of nowhere. As the crooks' plans start to unravel and they end up killing one of their captives, they come under attack from a mysterious psychopath who intends to make sure no one gets out of the building alive. Horror, starring Luke Evans and Adelaide Clemens

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in the Midlands (2002)
programme.desc: A Glaswegian crook heads for Nottingham after seeing his ex-wife humiliate her boyfriend on daytime television, determined that he should win back her heart. Shane Meadows' comedy, starring Robert Carlyle, Rhys Ifans, Shirley Henderson, Kathy Burke and Ricky Tomlinson

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: The Secret of Kells (2009)
programme.desc: A boy living in a medieval monastery under constant attack by Viking raiders acquires an unfinished book of mystical knowledge. The task of completing the tome falls to him, so he ventures into a haunted forest in search of the secrets required, where he must face his own darkest fears. Animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Evan McGuire, Christen Mooney and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: Lawrence of Arabia (1962)
programme.desc: An enigmatic British Army officer tries to unite the Arab nations against the Turks during the First World War, but comes into conflict with the military authorities when he engages the enemy with guerrilla tactics instead of more conventional methods. However, his increasingly torn loyalties leave him close to madness. Oscar-winning epic drama directed by David Lean, starring Peter O'Toole, Omar Sharif, Anthony Quinn, Alec Guinness and Jack Hawkins

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981)
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones goes in search of the legendary Ark of the Covenant, a biblical artefact of devastating power. His quest leads him to Egypt, where the Nazis are plotting to use the Ark to further Hitler's plans for world domination - aided by Jones's deceitful French rival. The first of five big-screen action adventures, starring Harrison Ford as Indy, with Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies

programme.title: The Equalizer (2014)
programme.desc: A retired secret agent applies his talents to the task of helping victims of injustice. When he witnesses a prostitute being beaten up by a pimp, he kills the man, an act that draws him into a battle to the death with a Russian crime syndicate. Action thriller based on the 1980s TV series, starring Denzel Washington and Chloe Grace Moretz

programme.title: Ready or Not (2019)
programme.desc: Grace Le Domas is a young bride whose wedding night takes a sinister turn when her eccentric new in-laws force her to take part in a terrifying game. Directors Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett's comedy horror, starring Samara Weaving, Adam Brody, Mark O'Brien, Henry Czerny and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: A Vigilante (2019)
programme.desc: After escaping her violent husband, a woman makes it her life's mission to help free others in danger. Drama, starring Olivia Wilde and Morgan Spector

programme.desc: Bob Mortimer has harboured a childhood dream to catch a salmon, so together with friend Paul Whitehouse, he sets off for the River Tay in Scotland full of hope and excitement. A ghillie guides them up the intimidating river in a boat and they fish using various methods to catch the elusive fish. They stay in the heart of the Highlands, where Bob cooks Paul a traditional Scottish breakfast and enjoy a swift round of golf before resuming their fishing. The duo also reflect on luck and fate and the part it has played in their lives and later assess whether the trip has lived up to their expectations

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing

The tables are turned when Bob reveals this week's accommodation - leaving Paul almost speechless. The following day the duo brave the open sea and have a very surprising catch. They celebrate in the only way possible in the south-west of England - it's not particularly heart-healthy but it proves to be very tasty

He travels to Perran Sands, where he searches for the lost church of St Piran, a place believed to be one of the earliest Christian sites in England. In Redruth, he explores the remains of the Cornish tin industry, before heading to St Ives, where he spends the night in Treganna Castle. programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives at a milestone on his American journey as he reaches the boundary between the northern and southern states, known as the Mason-Dixon line. Beginning in Wilmington, North Carolina, he uncovers the history of gunpowder production in Delaware, before heading to Baltimore, where he discovers how the first American steam engine owed a lot to British technology. On the city's east coast, Michael visits the star-shaped Fort McHenry, and learns how the Star-Spangled Banner national anthem was born

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Glasgow to Cumbrae, learning about a forgotten Scottish expedition to the Antarctic and how one woman led a protest against high rents in the city

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo falls into line with the University of Glasgow's Officer Training Corps, where he joins students for drill. The political pundit then heads west along the Firth of Clyde to Helensburgh, where he discovers a pioneering group of artists known as the Glasgow Boys. The idyllic West Highland Line takes Michael deep into the Highlands to Inveraray and the ancestral home of the Clan Campbell and Dukes of Argyll. Michael's final stop is Connel Ferry, near Oban, where, on the Achnacloich Estate, he discovers a Highland calf whose breed has become an icon of the Highlands

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Buxton to London, stopping at Cromford, Derbyshire, where Bradshaw's railway guide reports Richard Arkwright built his original cotton mill. He also visits Derby to take a walk through Britain's first public park, and heads for Burton-on-Trent for a tour of Burton Bridges Breweries

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's journey from Buxton to London continues in Walsall, where he visits a leather business that still supplies the Queen with saddlery. He then explores how the centre of Birmingham has changed since Bradshaw's times, and is taught how to cook a curry by the owner of a leading Indian restaurant. Finally, he heads to the village of Bournville, where he learns how the railway transformed the fortunes of the Cadbury brothers

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All Aboard
programme.desc: The annual Gala Festival is staged, showcasing steam engines from up and down the country. As part of the events, the North York Moors Railway has agreed to swap its precious 100-year-old Q6 engine, the last example in the world, with an engine from the Severn Valley heritage railway. However, there is a problem as the Q6 is undergoing a two-year overhaul and is not ready. A crack has been found in the engine box, and there is no specialist steam copper welder available at short notice to fix it. If the Q6 cannot be sent to the Severn Valley, the entire festival may be ruined

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Continuing his trek from Philadelphia to Jamestown, Michael Portillo arrives in the nation's capital, Washington, DC, centre of political power in the world's most powerful country. Steered by his Appleton's Guide of 1879, he admires its fine public buildings, including the largest library in the world, and discovers how the capital was built from scratch after a political compromise between north and south. After this, he travels on to Mount Vernon, exploring a former slave market and visiting an archaeological dig along the way

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A devastated cliff-top ruin, an extraordinarily tall tower, a concrete structure stranded at sea and a heavy metal monster in a field all feature

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross and rescued from an 'avalanche' by a St Bernard puppy. He takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps, and tries his hand at watchmaking, James Bond style

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo leaves Europe behind to take in the sights, smells and tastes of North Africa as he travels from the Mediterranean port of Tangier to the Berber city of Marrakech. At Asilah, the political commentator lends a hand with the construction of Morocco's new £3billion high-speed railway line to Casablanca, where he calls in to the most famous gin joint in the world

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the Italian Riviera to the Austrian Alps, starting in Genoa, where he learns how an Edwardian Briton introduced football to the port. He takes the train as it clings to the cliffs along the Riviera Di Levanti to reach the picturesque and remote villages of the Cinque Terre, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, before ending his journey in the famous Brenner Pass, the scene of a ground-breaking engineering project to build one of the world's longest rail tunnels

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo braves the freezing temperatures of the Baltic Sea and finds peace paddling a canoe on the Lakes of Finland. On his journey from the Latvian capital Riga to Tampere in Finland, he encounters medieval knights in Tallinn, grills sausages in Helsinki and samples cloudberry liqueur in a hot tub. He later arrives in Estonia, where in the setting of a ruined 13th-century cathedral he learns how the Baltic countries demonstrated their desire for independence from the Soviet Union with a 'singing revolution'

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo concludes his journey in the Netherlands, where he travels from Rotterdam to Utrecht, including a visit to the world's largest flower auction in Haarlem, a trip to Delft to learn how the city came to specialise in pottery and an exploration of the government buildings in The Hague

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Guided by his Bradshaw's 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel, Michael Portillo travels across India

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Margaret comes into money, Victor tries to help a Dutch girl get back on her feet, and builders arrive to start the loft conversion, leaving chaos in their wake. Comedy, guest starring Christopher Ryan (The Young Ones), with Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor receives an unlikely job offer that paves the way to disaster, and Margaret plays Cupid to Nick Swainey and a nurse. Meanwhile, the Meldrew household is plagued by a malfunctioning shower, marauding rugby players and a seemingly endless supply of frozen veg. Guest starring John Bird

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Paul heads to County Durham to pick up a 1936 Singer Le Mans sports car and a pristine 1957, one-owner Lambretta LD 150, while Derek gets his hands on a 1962 MGA MK2 Coupe

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The broadcaster travels from the west of Morocco to the east, heading into the desert on a mission to find out whether a railway line once crossed the Sahara all the way to Timbuktu in Mali. He begins in Marrakesh, taking in Casablanca and Fez before visiting a town that he is convinced has been named in his honour

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris sets out on a mission to cross three former Soviet republics entirely by rail in just one week, travelling through Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania and uncovering amazing stories and dark secrets from the region's past. He begins in Narva, Estonia, before heading to the capital Tallinn on the country's oldest railway, built by German nobles to connect the Russian imperial capital St Petersburg with Estonia's ports, then travelling through Latvia and Lithuania and heading to the Russian border on a revolutionary new line

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Garth Kirsten-Landman cooks kangaroo meat as he hosts the second night in Leeds. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Banker Sam Appleby wears a Henry VIII costume, complete with enormous codpiece, for his best-of-British-themed evening, as he hosts the third dinner party in Leeds. Property developer Diane's Margaret Thatcher costume causes some conflict, but there is some brief harmony when a busker arrives to lead the guests in singing a Beatles song

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Company administrator Louise Emmerson serves a Mediterranean menu inspired by her former mother-in-law, featuring Madrid chicken and aubergine bake. However, the guests are not impressed by the food, and Sam Appleby stokes the simmering feud between Diane Jones and the host, much to the shock of the other diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Property developer Diane Jones hosts the final dinner party in Leeds, and her guests have high expectations for the evening. She rustles up Greek filo pastries and cod in Italian sauce as well as entertaining her diners with Brazilian dancing on the lawn, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson helps Jeffrey and Trudi from Lincoln to find a home in Spain's Alicante province, on a budget of £220,000 raised from the sale of their home in the UK

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Glasgow with two couples whose budgets will not stretch to what they want. Kirstie is with Laura and Euan, who have recently returned to their native Glasgow from Sydney. But they are torn between their desire to be close to the vibrant West End or further out, where their budget will buy them something bigger. Phil has a wide brief with Miriam and David, who have spent eight months searching for their new home. He soon has success - the only problem is, they have each fallen for a different house

programme.title: Air Force One (1997)
programme.desc: The American president is forced to take drastic measures to save his family when their plane is hijacked by Russian terrorists demanding the release of a jailed radical general. Meanwhile, the vice president tries to manage the crisis from Washington and has to decide whether to shoot the aircraft down. Action thriller, starring Harrison Ford, Gary Oldman, Glenn Close, Dean Stockwell and William H Macy

programme.desc: In 1987, Californian teenager Charlie Watson is traumatised by the death of her father, while her mother Sally and new boyfriend Ron leaves her feeling even more alone. For her 18th-birthday she's given a yellow Volkswagen Beetle, which turns out to be the battle-scarred Autobot Bumblebee. Transformers prequel, starring Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Jorge Lendeborg Jr

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces, some of Britain's best loved personalities, turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers, sharing their opinions on what they have been watching during the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Magistrate Diane Whittaker hosts the final night of the competition in Essex, and hopes to introduce a touch of sophistication by making it a black-tie occasion. She also transforms her diners' hair, which proves to be a success, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Gloucestershire, married couple Paul and Debbie kick off the competition with a menu of tried and tested dinner party favourites. However, engaged couple Angela and John aren't impressed by their simple fare and posh couple Kirsty and James find Paul's behaviour even less palatable. Perfectionists Angela and John cook up dishes inspired by their favourite restaurant meals. Finally, Kirsty and James plan an organic, locally sourced menu. At the table there's a lesson in asparagus eating and the hosts get a dose of their own medicine when their guests return their food criticism

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: David and Christina Hurst are looking for a holiday home where they can eventually spend several months a year, and Jonnie Irwin shows them how far their £150,000 budget will stretch in Orlando, Florida

programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Laura Hamilton come to the aid of Paul and Ann Cruxton as they decide whether to relocate to Folkestone, Kent, or the south of France with their £300,000 budget as they plan for their retirement

programme.desc: In Málaga, Shani and Andrew help globetrotters Nigel and Hazel find a place to call home. With a maximum budget of 300,000 euros, Hazel's aversion to terracotta, and a quick property market where houses are selling faster than hot cakes, Shani and Andrew have a big challenge ahead

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo head for Crewe to meet rock 'n' roller Billy, who lives in a house that is frozen in time in the 1950s

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Water-feature builder Geoff Carter holds the first dinner party of the week in Warrington, Cheshire, and opts for an Asian-themed menu. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Call centre manager Stephen Robinson hosts the second night in Warrington, Cheshire, as guests are asked to dress appropriately for his pink and black theme. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beef farmer Alison Davies serves her guests Dyffd, one of her own Hereford cows, as part of her menu for the third dinner party in Warrington, Cheshire. She shows her fellow competitors round her property, but Linda Weaver has an accident in the duck pond

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Science teacher Emma Hoyle hosts the fourth dinner party in Warrington. Both the pili pili prawn starter and the chicken main course prove a success with the other contestants, and a soak in Emma's hot tub at the end of the meal seems to round off the evening perfectly

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Linda Weaver hosts the final night of the culinary competition in Warrington, Cheshire, inviting her fellow diners to a fancy-dress party with a multicultural theme. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Glasgow with two couples whose budgets will not stretch to what they want. But they are torn between their desire to be close to the vibrant West End or further out, where their budget will buy them something bigger. programme.title: Britain's Best Beach Hut
programme.desc: Craftsman and restorer Jay Blades and interior design expert Laura Jackson travel the UK's coastline in search of that quintessential seaside staple - the great British beach hut. More than 20,000 beach huts grace Britain's promenades, dunes, clifftops and sands and their variety is staggering, from the quirky and the ingenious to half-a-million-pound hideaways. Jay and Laura compete to find the best beach huts, visiting small seaside spaces that are as individual as their owners. Along the way, they take in traditional beach huts with a twist, luxurious tiny retreats and cutting-edge 21st-century designs

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: The Home County Cartel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The covert team tries to find the true identity of Jaguar Palace, as well as the evidence to link the suspect directly to the drug-importing conspiracy. The detectives begin a nerve-shredding wait for the criminal network to set up its lucrative operation again, and stand ready to strike against the ringleaders when it does

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith and journalist Clive Entwistle describe the killers' trial in 1966, and recall the tension in court as they faced justice, including the moment when a tape recording of a girl being tortured was played. The film also documents Myra Hindley's life in prison, and her protracted, unsuccessful campaign to secure her parole

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
