programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, as Jack Dee and Tom Allen take on Jon Richardson and Judi Love. John Cooper Clarke is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland is joined by comedian and presenter Tom Allen in Rome, where they eat ice cream before it melts, zip around the city on a rickety Vespa, train to be gladiators, learn to sing opera and make pasta from scratch. And will Tom's one-of-a-kind commentary do the Colosseum justice for Chris?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows from early March 2022, including Peaky Blinders, Love Is Blind, Coronation Street, Celebrity Hunted, Starstruck and Celebrity Mastermind. On a more serious note, they share their thoughts on the BBC's coverage of the outbreak of war in Ukraine

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: in Cardiff, DJ Trishna hopes her cooking will be even better than her rapping, as she hosts a hip-hop themed night in a bid to scoop the £1000 prize. However, when Yuno shakes his booty on the dance floor, opera-loving Nick is unimpressed and flirty Michelle lets her hands do the talking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the second day of the competition in Cardiff and Nick is planning to bring some refinement and fine dining to the week's proceedings. However, fastidious Nick really has set himself a mountain to climb with a massive tasting menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the third day in Cardiff, retail manager Yuno hopes to scoop the prize by whisking his guests off to the Himalayas. As well as entertaining his guests with some traditional dancing, Yuno's also hoping to tickle their taste buds by serving up Nepalese food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's day four of the competition in Cardiff and turn of self-appointed 'hostess with the mostest' Michelle. She's out to impress with a culinary trip around the world, but when she sets a fun challenge, she ends up being accused of cheating

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night of the competition in Cardiff, host Suzanne is pinning her hopes on an evening of sophistication and fine French cuisine. Suzanne's menu is inspired by her many holidays to France - in fact she's been every year for the last 17 years. However, revealing the inspiration behind her starter might be a step too far for her guests, especially after the revelations found inside her 'special' cupboard!

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Portsmouth at the Seacrest Hotel, where owner Antoinette Stretton and general manager Carmen Cretu hope their experience will set them apart

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The White Horse Hotel in Storrington, West Sussex, is today's venue. The discovery of damp is a cause for concern - and emotions run high as the scores are handed out

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Deri-Down Guesthouse in Abergavenny, Wales, where husbands and wife Mike and Del Hayward hope to impress their rivals

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Royle Farm in Staffordshire, where mother and son Margaret and Fraser Mountford hope their farmhouse with a difference will capture the guests' imaginations

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up for a final showdown. First to seek some answers on their feedback are Antoinette and Carmen, who want to uncover Glenn and Leon's bedtime blues and share with Mike and Del why their feedback drove them 'potty'. Next, Glenn and Leon comb through Mike and Del's cleanliness comments, before delving into discussions of damp with Antoinette and Carmen. After opinions are aired and differences debated, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Mike Bodnar and Liz Prendergast live on a houseboat in France for most of the year, but would like somewhere warmer for the winter months. They know the sun always shines in Tenerife, but are also drawn to Mike's native Liverpool as they have friends there and Liz could get work. Jasmine Harman and Sara Damergi help them make up their minds

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi assists a couple seeking a property on the southern Spanish Costa Blanca with beautiful views. The presenter shows Reg and Val Thorne what their £82,000 budget will stretch to, but has difficulty finding a house that the pair can agree on

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jasmine Harman and Sara Damergi help Nathan and Georgina Spender, who are hoping to invest some money they inherited from their parents by downsizing in Leicestershire and buying a property in Lanzarote that they can initially use for holidays, with a view to eventually making it their permanent home

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Bedfordshire couple John and Elaine Want plan a permanent move to the Alicante region of southern Spain, and Sara Damergi takes them to view potential homes within their budget of £70,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sports fan and rugby coach Matt loves all-things Italian and dreams of buying a holiday home near the historic city of Lucca in Tuscany. He's looking for a property with two bedrooms in a lively location, and brings along his best friend Shaun for some straight-talking advice. Jean Johansson secures the options of five properties for him to vivist within his £190,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Themis and Paolo have been visiting the unspoilt beaches of Kapparis in Cyprus for the past six years and now they want to buy their own holiday home. Jasmine Harman lines up five properties for their £180,000 budget

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Members of the Fullagar family get more than they bargained for when they are introduced to father and daughter, Pepe and Tink - who can't be separated. Meanwhile, Louise and Angela are conflicted when Trinity a five-month-old lurcher puppy shows off both her adorable side and an impressive ability to chew everything from furniture to shoes

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets actor Sean Simons, who has bought the ruins of Cloontykilla Castle in Co Roscommon with a view to using them to create a spectacular mock 16th-century home. However, the outlandish plans - including Jacuzzis in the battlements and water-spouting gargoyles - have Kevin worried the project could become a garish nightmare, and his scepticism increases when he realises Sean has not consulted an architect. Disaster seems to be looming as the contractors grow frustrated and planning regulations are ignored, but somehow things slowly begin to take shape - until a national economic crisis plunges everything into chaos

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: The Home County Cartel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The covert team tries to find the true identity of Jaguar Palace, as well as the evidence to link the suspect directly to the drug-importing conspiracy. The detectives begin a nerve-shredding wait for the criminal network to set up its lucrative operation again, and stand ready to strike against the ringleaders when it does

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nurse Emma is called to resus to help 71-year-old Thomas who has had a suspected stroke, and has a narrow window of time to give Thomas a life-saving drug. While treating him, Emma tells us the story of how she went from working in a dry-cleaners as a teenager to pursuing a career as a stroke nurse. At the same time, 88-year-old Mary is rushed to St George's after falling at home and injuring her head

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A cast of famous faces including Miquita and Andi Oliver, Mo Gilligan with Babatunde Aléshé, Jamie Carragher and Micah Richards, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Big Zuu, Hyder and Tubsey, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, and Denise van Outen and Duncan James, comment on the week's TV

programme.title: Larry Dean: Fandan
programme.desc: The double Edinburgh Comedy Award nominee performs his debut special, recorded in his hometown of Glasgow. He takes us through his attempt to win friends through bank robbery, getting tea with murderers and memorable misdemeanours in a Dubai hotel room. Larry journeys through ghosting, battling the organised partner in relationships, and announcing his sexuality with a bang - in a proudly Scottish voice

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Harrogate spot a youth behaving suspiciously, but when they try to stop him, he flees into a local housing estate and things rapidly escalate as a hostile crowd gathers. As they attempt to pull the car over, the suspects speed off and the chase is on. The police conduct a raid on a house near York, on the hunt for a suspected drug dealer, while a routine patrol takes a sinister turn when a man in a bar is spotted with a knife

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: An 80mph pursuit carries on for 15 miles across North Yorkshire, while wet roads make a 90mph chase near Scarborough even more dangerous. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jo and Mike track down a VW Golf that was involved in a robbery to a petrol station, but as they try to stop the driver, the fleeing car slams into Jo and then smashes through the pumps in a desperate bid to escape

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Runaway drivers are convinced to stop by the threat of 50,000 volts, a suspected drink-driver resists arrest and receives a face full of incapacitating PAVA spray, a fresh-faced and uninsured motorist tries to pass himself off as his 52-year-old father

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.desc: The doctors of Hall Green Health come face to face with some rare conditions. First up is regular elderly patient Catherine, who is in to see Dr Aireen Razak about her dizziness and balance issues, which recently caused a fall. This looks like a case of vertigo, but seven years ago, Catherine was diagnosed with a neurological condition called Guillain-Barré syndrome, and it may be flaring up. programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When the lead suspect of an unsolved and high-profile robbery case is released from prison, the NCIS team members resume their investigation with an undercover stakeout

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate when a student is shot dead after a party gets out of control. The victim's boyfriend is arrested, but the officers later receive a tip-off about someone else - a vengeful youth deliberately infecting girls with HIV. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate an attack on a nurse, and discover she had been moving house regularly in an effort to evade a stalker who terrorised her with distressing e-mails. The victim regains consciousness, but fails to identify her attacker, leading to the shocking revelation that she may have fabricated the assault story as a way of attracting attention

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the disappearance of a wealthy couple seemingly snatched from their apartment building, but suspicion eventually falls on a man suffering from mental illness - presenting Ross with a tough ethical decision. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach, Benjamin Bratt and Carey Lowell

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis examine the murder of a popular Harlem community leader, while McCoy and Carmichael struggle to prevent a chaotic situation. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston, Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis hunt for the suspected killer of a parolee - but matters are complicated by the discovery that two bounty hunters are also pursuing their quarry. Acclaimed drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis join forces with their Baltimore colleagues to investigate the murder of a government official. It soon emerges that the deceased had been stalked by a man because of her lesbian affair with a married woman, who pleads for her identity to be kept secret. However, an over-zealous attorney embarks on a crusade to make the information public knowledge, going so far as to take the officers to court in an effort to force them to reveal their source - but his interest in the case raises suspicions

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a marine sergeant, who was hailed as a war hero in the States for his efforts overseas. Gibbs turns to medic Grace Confalone for advice after he uncharacteristically unravels and abandons his team at a crime scene investigation. Mark Harmon stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ex-FBI agent Tobias Fornell pleads with Gibbs to do whatever is necessary to take down drug dealers in the area after his daughter is hospitalised from an opiate overdose, leaving Gibbs feeling haunted by aspects of the case. Mark Harmon stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ziva returns and informs Gibbs that his life is in danger, and they are forced to go on the run to locate the criminal mastermind responsible as the team investigates. Naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Jackie set out to investigate the murder of a bride on her wedding day in a drive-by shooting. However, they are quickly pulled off the case and assigned to the protection detail of unpopular foreign president Rafael Valverde, who is in town for a kidney operation. Elsewhere, Jamie questions his new partner's methods when he performs an unjustifiable stop-and-search on a teenager. Guest starring Tony Plana (Ugly Betty)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Newspaper columnist Jimmy MacArthur is given full access to the squad for an inside look at the New York Police Department. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay, Danny Pino and Ice-T

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A single mother faces charges of child neglect after her six-year-old daughter is discovered home alone. However, Benson suspects there is more to her story and his investigations reveal she not only suffered sexual abuse as a child but also featured in scores of images and videos popular with online paedophiles - forcing the woman to face up to her past. Starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate when three dehydrated survivors from a helicopter crash are discovered. The pilot is initially missing, but his body later washes ashore with a gunshot wound to the head. Things get complicated when one of the crew members tells the agents the chopper was hit by another aircraft, while another states that the pilot tried to kill them all by crashing into the sea on purpose. American drama, starring Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The driver of a Ferrari is gunned down by a motorcyclist and the victim is identified as petty officer Colin Boxer, who was holding down a second job as a valet parker and had borrowed the sports car. The owner of the vehicle turns out to be Vijay Chaya, the billionaire head of a large corporation, and the team suspects a case of mistaken identity. During the course of the investigation, Gibbs chances on a medal awarded to Leroy Jethro Moore, the man he was named after and an estranged friend of his father. Guest starring Billy Dee Williams (The Empire Strikes Back) and Ralph Waite (The Waltons)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Jackie investigate a shooting at a diner, but are concerned to discover a uniformed police officer is the chief suspect. Frank is unhappy with a planned recruitment drive that seeks to exploit people's fear of terrorism, and decides to devise a more positive campaign. Meanwhile, Jamie is forced to take on a second job as he struggles to clear his debts

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny is caught up in a chase involving a gunman while driving his family home. Despite being off-duty, he draws his gun in an attempt to apprehend the attacker - but puts Linda and their sons in danger as a result. Meanwhile, Frank begins sessions with a psychiatrist after discovering one of the people he worked alongside at Ground Zero is about to die. Guest starring F Murray Abraham (Amadeus)

programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Curtis and Briscoe question a disabled boy's bereaved family in an attempt to establish whether his death was a mercy killing or cold-blooded murder, and discover his mother is not as respectable as she makes herself out to be. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A female cop is found stabbed to death in a park alongside a Hispanic male with a near-fatal gunshot wound. Further investigations lead Briscoe and Curtis to a girl who suffered a tough childhood in the care of an abusive father and drug-addicted mother, and her alibi appears to be flimsy at best. Robert Vaughn guest stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A newly appointed judge is knocked over and killed while trying to escape from the tabloid journalist who has been harassing her. The team is all set to press charges against the reporter, but it soon becomes clear there is more to the case than meets the eye. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The officers discover a girl's body in a hospital emergency room, and the subsequent investigation leads to the revelation that she was killed during an unauthorised exorcism carried out by an overzealous nun who claims her behaviour was directed by the voice of an angel. Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation into a fatal attack on a semi-retired divorce lawyer by a disgruntled client reveals a network of bribery and corrupt medical practices. As the team unravels the tangled threads of the case, it appears a trio of doctors may be destined for prosecution - and it is not long before a further murder occurs. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

The felon he was trying to snare becomes the chief suspect, and Briscoe and Curtis eventually track him down, only to discover the murdered cop had a history of violence against his girlfriend. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: With their lives in danger, Gibbs and Ziva's rogue investigation takes an unexpected turn when a possible terrorist plot is revealed

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team links a bizarre crime scene at Arlington National Cemetery to a string of attacks on homeless veterans, while Vance orders McGee, Bishop and Torres to complete hours of evidence garage clean-up duty for withholding information

programme.title: NCIS

programme.desc: Benson is assigned round-the-clock security when sadistic killer William Lewis makes contact with her after escaping from his hospital prison guard. Starring Mariska Hargitay and Pablo Schreiber

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.desc: Part one of two. First lieutenant Michael Torres gets involved in a fight before falling to the ground, and is found beaten to death the next morning. The only witness is his friend and colleague Captain Joe Westcott, who suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder and has trouble distinguishing reality from his past military experiences in the Middle East

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Back at HQ, Abby creates a 3D computer model of the attack that occurred in Afghanistan and Joe dons a virtual-reality headset to relive the traumatic events. Will it jog his memory?

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: The day of Kate's Oxford interview dawns, but Mary's support is short-lived when she has to rush back to London to help a teenage mother hiding an important secret. William is put under pressure by Billy Two Hats to commit to the band and later faces a difficult situation at work when he has to consider the possibility his client was the victim of a mercy killing. Brendan gives Reuben a frosty reception when he turns up unannounced and Molly begins her treatment. Romantic drama, starring Peta Cornish, Julie Graham, Martin Clunes, Ricci Mcleod and Paterson Joseph

programme.title: The Smallest Show on Earth (1957)
programme.desc: A newly married couple inherit a dilapidated cinema and its incompetent staff and resolve to transform its fortunes. They soon find, however, that their hopes for the future are far more difficult to realise than anticipated. Basil Dearden's comedy, starring Bill Travers, Virginia McKenna, Peter Sellers, Margaret Rutherford, Bernard Miles and Leslie Phillips

programme.title: The Great Pony Raid (1968)
programme.desc: A gang of children tries to foil a plot to steal Dartmoor ponies. Family drama, starring Edward Underdown and Michael Brennan

programme.title: Big Wheels and Sailor (1979)
programme.desc: The children of long-distance lorry drivers are taken prisoner by a gang of lorry hijackers led by the owner of a cab company, but the captive kids have a trick or two up their sleeves. Children's adventure, starring Nigel Humphreys and Matthew Wright

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The chef creates a selection of mouthwatering fast food, including curried moules mariniere, bacon and cheese potato wedges and harissa-rubbed lamb

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to visit more islands off the coastline, beginning with the Outer Hebrides. He resumes his journey on Eriskay, where he discovers how the remote location helped preserve a unique way of life for centuries - and also allowed locals to hide thousands of bottles of whisky from the excise men when a ship laden with the thirst-quenching cargo ran aground in 1941. The story inspired the 1949 movie Whisky Galore! Moving on to Barra, Paul goes foraging for cockles and visits the only airport in the world where scheduled flights land on the beach, then heads across to Vatersay, where he joins local fishermen trawling for lobsters

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the Isle of Mull and its satellite islands to discover why they have become boltholes from the hustle and bustle of the modern world. He begins on the tidal island of Erraid, which inspired famous Scottish writer Robert Louis Stevenson, then hops over to Ulva, the final resting place of Lachlan MacQuarrie, one of the first governors of New South Wales. He then explores Mull itself, being given a whistlestop tour of the island by rally driver Louise Thomas, then travels to the mysterious little island of Inch Kenneth, where he hears the story of Nazi sympathizer Unity Mitford. He ends his tour at the remote Treshnish Islands, where he experiences a spot of 'puffin therapy'

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: Kate and her Welsh sheepdog Teg conclude their journey across the remote Welsh countryside by exploring Carmarthenshire, herding and milking goats in the Cothi Valley and trying her hand at trotting in Capel Iwan. In Cwm Elfed, she meets an Englishman keeping Welsh weaving tradition alive, sees how beavers are transforming a Welsh farm near Carmarthen and rows across the Towy estuary to reach the end of her journey

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe

programme.title: Biggles: Adventure In Time (1986)
programme.desc: A New York businessman is mysteriously transported back in time to the First World War, where he meets the famed British flying ace Biggles. The time traveller discovers he has been sent back to help the daredevil pilot destroy a German secret weapon that could change the course of history. Sci-fi adventure, starring Neil Dickson, Alex Hyde-White and Peter Cushing in his final film role

programme.title: Nutcracker (1982)
programme.desc: A Russian ballerina defects to the West, and is drawn into a web of intrigue when she joins a London company run by a powerful, possessive woman. Drama, starring Joan Collins, Paul Nicholas and Finola Hughes

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.title: The Dark Horse (2014)
programme.desc: A bipolar chess champion is released from a psychiatric hospital with nowhere to go, so moves in with his gang member brother. Needing a purpose, he forms a club to teach his skills to a group of underprivileged youngsters, but struggles with the strain of being a role model, particularly when his nephew seems set to follow in his father's criminal footsteps. Fact-based drama, starring Cliff Curtis and James Rolleston

programme.title: Albatross (2011)
programme.desc: Bookish teenager Beth is desperate to escape her dull home life. She finds a kindred spirit in Emelia, a troubled 17-year-old with dreams of becoming a writer, who comes to work at her parents' hotel. Emelia forms a friendship with Beth, but also has an affair with her father, which threatens to tear the family apart. Drama, with Jessica Brown Findlay, Felicity Jones, Sebastian Koch and Julia Ormond

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong quizzes another line-up of famous faces on the general knowledge game show. The teams are former England international rugby union stars Ben Cohen and Kyran Bracken, children's TV stalwarts Helen Skelton and Dani Harmer, The Office actors Patrick Baladi and Ewen MacIntosh, and EastEnders stars Cheryl Fergison and Ricky Groves. Who'll be best when it comes to picking the most obscure correct responses? Richard Osman is the one with the answers

programme.desc: A classic episode of the award-winning quiz show presented by Chris Tarrant in which contestants can win up to one million pounds.

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings
